And for the purity of my prayer!-c

translations.hebrew: אֶ֭רֶץ אַל־תְּכַסִּ֣י דָמִ֑י וְֽאַל־יְהִ֥י מָ֝ק֗וֹם לְזַעֲקָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
Earth, do not cover my blood;
Let there be no resting place for my outcry!

translations.hebrew: גַּם־עַ֭תָּה הִנֵּה־בַשָּׁמַ֣יִם עֵדִ֑י וְ֝שָׂהֲדִ֗י בַּמְּרֹמִֽים׃
translations.english:
Surely now my witness is in heaven;
He who can testify for me is on high.

translations.hebrew: מְלִיצַ֥י רֵעָ֑י אֶל־אֱ֝ל֗וֹהַּ דָּלְפָ֥ה עֵינִֽי׃
translations.english:
O my advocates, my fellows,
Before God my eyes shed tears;

translations.hebrew: וְיוֹכַ֣ח לְגֶ֣בֶר עִם־אֱל֑וֹהַּ וּֽבֶן־אָדָ֥ם לְרֵעֵֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
Let Him arbitrate between a man and God
As between a man and his fellow.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־שְׁנ֣וֹת מִסְפָּ֣ר יֶאֱתָ֑יוּ וְאֹ֖רַח לֹא־אָשׁ֣וּב אֶהֱלֹֽךְ׃
translations.english:
For a few more years will pass,
And I shall go the way of no return.

translations.hebrew: רוּחִ֣י חֻ֭בָּלָה יָמַ֥י נִזְעָ֗כוּ קְבָרִ֥ים לִֽי׃
translations.english:
My spirit is crushed, my days run out;
The graveyard waits for me.

translations.hebrew: אִם־לֹ֣א הֲ֭תֻלִים עִמָּדִ֑י וּ֝בְהַמְּרוֹתָ֗ם תָּלַ֥ן עֵינִֽי׃
translations.english:
Surely mocking men keep me company,
And with their provocations I close my eyes.

translations.hebrew: שִֽׂימָה־נָּ֭א עׇרְבֵ֣נִי עִמָּ֑ךְ מִ֥י ה֝֗וּא לְיָדִ֥י יִתָּקֵֽעַ׃
translations.english:
Come now, stand surety for me!
Who will give his hand on my behalf?

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־לִ֭בָּם צָפַ֣נְתָּ מִשָּׂ֑כֶל עַל־כֵּ֝֗ן לֹ֣א תְרֹמֵֽם׃
translations.english:
You have hidden understanding from their minds;
Therefore You must not exalt [them].

translations.hebrew: לְ֭חֵלֶק יַגִּ֣יד רֵעִ֑ים וְעֵינֵ֖י בָנָ֣יו תִּכְלֶֽנָה׃
translations.english:
He informs on his friends for a share [of their property],
And his children’s eyes pine away.

translations.hebrew: וְֽ֭הִצִּיגַנִי לִמְשֹׁ֣ל עַמִּ֑ים וְתֹ֖פֶת לְפָנִ֣ים אֶהְיֶֽה׃
translations.english:
He made me a byword among people;
I have become like TophetaThat consumed children; cf. Jer. 7.31. of old.

translations.hebrew: וַתֵּ֣כַהּ מִכַּ֣עַשׂ עֵינִ֑י וִיצֻרַ֖י כַּצֵּ֣ל כֻּלָּֽם׃
translations.english:
My eyes fail from vexation;
All shapes seem to me like shadows.

translations.hebrew: יָשֹׁ֣מּוּ יְשָׁרִ֣ים עַל־זֹ֑את וְ֝נָקִ֗י עַל־חָנֵ֥ף יִתְעֹרָֽר׃
translations.english:
The upright are amazed at this;
The pure are aroused against the impious.

translations.hebrew: וְיֹאחֵ֣ז צַדִּ֣יק דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וּֽטְהׇר־יָ֝דַ֗יִם יֹסִ֥יף אֹֽמֶץ׃
translations.english:
The righteous man holds to his way;
He whose hands are clean grows stronger.

translations.hebrew: וְֽאוּלָ֗ם כֻּלָּ֣ם תָּ֭שֻׁבוּ וּבֹ֣אוּ נָ֑א וְלֹֽא־אֶמְצָ֖א בָכֶ֣ם חָכָֽם׃
translations.english:
But all of you, come back now;
I shall not find a wise man among you.

translations.hebrew: יָמַ֣י עָ֭בְרוּ זִמֹּתַ֣י נִתְּק֑וּ מ֖וֹרָשֵׁ֣י לְבָבִֽי׃
translations.english:
My days are done, my tendons severed,
The strings of my heart.

translations.hebrew: לַ֭יְלָה לְי֣וֹם יָשִׂ֑ימוּ א֝֗וֹר קָר֥וֹב מִפְּנֵי־חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃
translations.english:
They say that night is day,
That light is here—in the face of darkness.

translations.hebrew: אִם־אֲ֭קַוֶּה שְׁא֣וֹל בֵּיתִ֑י בַּ֝חֹ֗שֶׁךְ רִפַּ֥דְתִּי יְצוּעָֽי׃
translations.english:
If I must look forward to Sheol as my home,
And make my bed in the dark place,

translations.hebrew: לַשַּׁ֣חַת קָ֭רָאתִי אָ֣בִי אָ֑תָּה אִמִּ֥י וַ֝אֲחֹתִ֗י לָרִמָּֽה׃
translations.english:
Say to the Pit, “You are my father,”
To the maggots, “Mother,” “Sister”—

translations.hebrew: וְ֭אַיֵּה אֵפ֣וֹ תִקְוָתִ֑י וְ֝תִקְוָתִ֗י מִ֣י יְשׁוּרֶֽנָּה׃
translations.english:
Where, then, is my hope?
Who can see hope for me?

translations.hebrew: בַּדֵּ֣י שְׁאֹ֣ל תֵּרַ֑דְנָה אִם־יַ֖חַד עַל־עָפָ֣ר נָֽחַת׃
translations.english:
Will it descend to Sheol?
Shall we go down together to the dust?

translations.hebrew: וַ֭יַּעַן בִּלְדַּ֥ד הַשֻּׁחִ֗י וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
translations.english: Then Bildad the Shuhite said in reply:

translations.hebrew: עַד־אָ֤נָה ׀ תְּשִׂימ֣וּן קִנְצֵ֣י לְמִלִּ֑ין תָּ֝בִ֗ינוּ וְאַחַ֥ר נְדַבֵּֽר׃
translations.english:
How long? Put an end to talk!
Consider, and then we shall speak.

translations.hebrew: מַ֭דּוּעַ נֶחְשַׁ֣בְנוּ כַבְּהֵמָ֑ה נִ֝טְמִ֗ינוּ בְּעֵינֵיכֶֽם׃
translations.english:
Why are we thought of as brutes,
Regarded by you as stupid?

translations.hebrew: טֹרֵ֥ף נַפְשׁ֗וֹ בְּאַ֫פּ֥וֹ הַֽ֭לְמַעַנְךָ תֵּעָ֣זַב אָ֑רֶץ וְיֶעְתַּק־צ֝֗וּר מִמְּקֹמֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
You who tear yourself to pieces in anger—
Will aLit. “the earth be abandoned.”earth’s order be disrupted-a for your sake?
Will rocks be dislodged from their place?

translations.hebrew: גַּ֤ם א֣וֹר רְשָׁעִ֣ים יִדְעָ֑ךְ וְלֹא־יִ֝גַּ֗הּ שְׁבִ֣יב אִשּֽׁוֹ׃
translations.english:
Indeed, the light of the wicked fails;
The flame of his fire does not shine.

translations.hebrew: א֭וֹר חָשַׁ֣ךְ בְּאׇהֳל֑וֹ וְ֝נֵר֗וֹ עָלָ֥יו יִדְעָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
The light in his tent darkens;
His lamp fails him.

translations.hebrew: יֵ֭צְרוּ צַעֲדֵ֣י אוֹנ֑וֹ וְֽתַשְׁלִיכֵ֥הוּ עֲצָתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
His iniquitous strides are hobbled;
His schemes overthrow him.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־שֻׁלַּ֣ח בְּרֶ֣שֶׁת בְּרַגְלָ֑יו וְעַל־שְׂ֝בָכָ֗ה יִתְהַלָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
He is led by his feet into the net;
He walks onto the toils.

translations.hebrew: יֹאחֵ֣ז בְּעָקֵ֣ב פָּ֑ח יַחֲזֵ֖ק עָלָ֣יו צַמִּֽים׃
translations.english:
The trap seizes his heel;
The noose tightens on him.

translations.hebrew: טָמ֣וּן בָּאָ֣רֶץ חַבְל֑וֹ וּ֝מַלְכֻּדְתּ֗וֹ עֲלֵ֣י נָתִֽיב׃
translations.english:
The rope for him lies hidden on the ground;
His snare, on the path.

translations.hebrew: סָ֭בִיב בִּעֲתֻ֣הוּ בַלָּה֑וֹת וֶהֱפִיצֻ֥הוּ לְרַגְלָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Terrors assault him on all sides
And send his feet flying.

translations.hebrew: יְהִי־רָעֵ֥ב אֹנ֑וֹ וְ֝אֵ֗יד נָכ֥וֹן לְצַלְעֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
His progeny hunger;
Disaster awaits his wife.bLit. “rib” (cf. Gen. 2.22); or “stumbling.”

translations.hebrew: יֹ֭אכַל בַּדֵּ֣י עוֹר֑וֹ יֹאכַ֥ל בַּ֝דָּ֗יו בְּכ֣וֹר מָֽוֶת׃
translations.english:
The tendons under his skin are consumed;
Death’s first-born consumes his tendons.

translations.hebrew: יִנָּתֵ֣ק מֵ֭אׇהֳלוֹ מִבְטַח֑וֹ וְ֝תַצְעִדֵ֗הוּ לְמֶ֣לֶךְ בַּלָּהֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
He is torn from the safety of his tent;
Terror marches him to the king.cViz., of the netherworld.

translations.hebrew: תִּשְׁכּ֣וֹן בְּ֭אׇהֳלוֹ מִבְּלִיל֑וֹ יְזֹרֶ֖ה עַל־נָוֵ֣הוּ גׇפְרִֽית׃
translations.english:
It lodges in his desolate tent;
Sulfur is strewn upon his home.

translations.hebrew: מִ֭תַּחַת שׇׁרָשָׁ֣יו יִבָ֑שׁוּ וּ֝מִמַּ֗עַל יִמַּ֥ל קְצִירֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
His roots below dry up,
And above, his branches wither.

translations.hebrew: זִֽכְרוֹ־אָ֭בַד מִנִּי־אָ֑רֶץ וְלֹא־שֵׁ֥ם ל֝֗וֹ עַל־פְּנֵי־חֽוּץ׃
translations.english:
All mention of him vanishes from the earth;
He has no name abroad.

translations.hebrew: יֶ֭הְדְּפֻהוּ מֵא֣וֹר אֶל־חֹ֑שֶׁךְ וּֽמִתֵּבֵ֥ל יְנִדֻּֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
He is thrust from light to darkness,
Driven from the world.

translations.hebrew: לֹ֘א־נִ֤ין ל֣וֹ וְלֹא־נֶ֣כֶד בְּעַמּ֑וֹ וְאֵ֥ין שָׂ֝רִ֗יד בִּמְגוּרָֽיו׃
translations.english:
He has no seed or breed among his people,
No survivor where he once lived.

translations.hebrew: עַל־י֭וֹמוֹ נָשַׁ֣מּוּ אַחֲרֹנִ֑ים וְ֝קַדְמֹנִ֗ים אָ֣חֲזוּ שָֽׂעַר׃
translations.english:
Generations to come will be appalled at his fate,
As the previous ones are seized with horror.

translations.hebrew: אַךְ־אֵ֭לֶּה מִשְׁכְּנ֣וֹת עַוָּ֑ל וְ֝זֶ֗ה מְק֣וֹם לֹֽא־יָדַֽע־אֵֽל׃
translations.english:
“These were the haunts of the wicked;
Here was the place of him who knew not God.”

translations.hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
translations.english: Job said in reply:

translations.hebrew: עַד־אָ֭נָה תּוֹגְי֣וּן נַפְשִׁ֑י וּֽתְדַכּאוּנַ֥נִי בְמִלִּֽים׃
translations.english:
How long will you grieve my spirit,
And crush me with words?

translations.hebrew: זֶ֤ה עֶ֣שֶׂר פְּ֭עָמִים תַּכְלִימ֑וּנִי לֹֽא־תֵ֝בֹ֗שׁוּ תַּהְכְּרוּ־לִֽי׃
translations.english:
aLit. “Ten times.”Time and again-a you humiliate me,
And are not ashamed to abuse me.

translations.hebrew: וְאַף־אׇמְנָ֥ם שָׁגִ֑יתִי אִ֝תִּ֗י תָּלִ֥ין מְשׁוּגָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
If indeed I have erred,
My error remains with me.

translations.hebrew: אִם־אׇ֭מְנָם עָלַ֣י תַּגְדִּ֑ילוּ וְתוֹכִ֥יחוּ עָ֝לַ֗י חֶרְפָּתִֽי׃
translations.english:
Though you are overbearing toward me,
Reproaching me with my disgrace,

translations.hebrew: דְּֽעוּ־אֵ֭פוֹ כִּֽי־אֱל֣וֹהַּ עִוְּתָ֑נִי וּ֝מְצוּד֗וֹ עָלַ֥י הִקִּֽיף׃
translations.english:
Yet know that God has wronged me;
He has thrown up siege works around me.

translations.hebrew: הֵ֤ן אֶצְעַ֣ק חָ֭מָס וְלֹ֣א אֵעָנֶ֑ה אֲ֝שַׁוַּ֗ע וְאֵ֣ין מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
translations.english:
I cry, “Violence!” but am not answered;
I shout, but can get no justice.

translations.hebrew: אׇרְחִ֣י גָ֭דַר וְלֹ֣א אֶעֱב֑וֹר וְעַ֥ל נְ֝תִיבוֹתַ֗י חֹ֣שֶׁךְ יָשִֽׂים׃
translations.english:
He has barred my way; I cannot pass;
He has laid darkness upon my path.

translations.hebrew: כְּ֭בוֹדִי מֵעָלַ֣י הִפְשִׁ֑יט וַ֝יָּ֗סַר עֲטֶ֣רֶת רֹאשִֽׁי׃
translations.english:
He has stripped me of my glory,
Removed the crown from my head.

translations.hebrew: יִתְּצֵ֣נִי סָ֭בִיב וָאֵלַ֑ךְ וַיַּסַּ֥ע כָּ֝עֵ֗ץ תִּקְוָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
He tears down every part of me; I perish;
He uproots my hope like a tree.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּ֣חַר עָלַ֣י אַפּ֑וֹ וַיַּחְשְׁבֵ֖נִי ל֣וֹ כְצָרָֽיו׃
translations.english:
He kindles His anger against me;
He regards me as one of His foes.

translations.hebrew: יַ֤חַד ׀ יָ֘בֹ֤אוּ גְדוּדָ֗יו וַיָּסֹ֣לּוּ עָלַ֣י דַּרְכָּ֑ם וַיַּחֲנ֖וּ סָבִ֣יב לְאׇהֳלִֽי׃
translations.english:
His troops advance together;
They build their road toward me
And encamp around my tent.

translations.hebrew: אַ֭חַי מֵעָלַ֣י הִרְחִ֑יק וְ֝יֹדְעַ֗י אַךְ־זָ֥רוּ מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
translations.english:
He alienated my kin from me;
My acquaintances disown me.

translations.hebrew: חָדְל֥וּ קְרוֹבָ֑י וּֽמְיֻדָּעַ֥י שְׁכֵחֽוּנִי׃
translations.english:
My relatives are gone;
My friends have forgotten me.

translations.hebrew: גָּ֘רֵ֤י בֵיתִ֣י וְ֭אַמְהֹתַי לְזָ֣ר תַּחְשְׁבֻ֑נִי נׇ֝כְרִ֗י הָיִ֥יתִי בְעֵינֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
My dependents and maidservants regard me as a stranger;
I am an outsider to them.

translations.hebrew: לְעַבְדִּ֣י קָ֭רָאתִי וְלֹ֣א יַעֲנֶ֑ה בְּמוֹ־פִ֝֗י אֶתְחַנֶּן־לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
I summon my servant but he does not respond;
I must myself entreat him.

translations.hebrew: ר֭וּחִי זָ֣רָה לְאִשְׁתִּ֑י וְ֝חַנֹּתִ֗י לִבְנֵ֥י בִטְנִֽי׃
translations.english:
My odor is repulsive to my wife;
I am loathsome to my children.

translations.hebrew: גַּם־עֲ֭וִילִים מָ֣אֲסוּ בִ֑י אָ֝ק֗וּמָה וַיְדַבְּרוּ־בִֽי׃
translations.english:
Even youngsters disdain me;
When I rise, they speak against me.

translations.hebrew: תִּ֭עֲבוּנִי כׇּל־מְתֵ֣י סוֹדִ֑י וְזֶה־אָ֝הַ֗בְתִּי נֶהְפְּכוּ־בִֽי׃
translations.english:
All my bosom friends detest me;
Those I love have turned against me.

translations.hebrew: בְּעוֹרִ֣י וּ֭בִבְשָׂרִי דָּבְקָ֣ה עַצְמִ֑י וָ֝אֶתְמַלְּטָ֗ה בְּע֣וֹר שִׁנָּֽי׃
translations.english:
My bones stick to my skin and flesh;
I escape with the skin of my teeth.

translations.hebrew: חׇנֻּ֬נִי חׇנֻּ֣נִי אַתֶּ֣ם רֵעָ֑י כִּ֥י יַד־אֱ֝ל֗וֹהַּ נָ֣גְעָה בִּֽי׃
translations.english:
Pity me, pity me! You are my friends;
For the hand of God has struck me!

translations.hebrew: לָ֭מָּה תִּרְדְּפֻ֣נִי כְמוֹ־אֵ֑ל וּ֝מִבְּשָׂרִ֗י לֹ֣א תִשְׂבָּֽעוּ׃
translations.english:
Why do you pursue me like God,
bLit. “You are not satisfied with my flesh.”Maligning me insatiably?-b

translations.hebrew: מִי־יִתֵּ֣ן אֵ֭פוֹ וְיִכָּתְב֣וּן מִלָּ֑י מִי־יִתֵּ֖ן בַּסֵּ֣פֶר וְיֻחָֽקוּ׃
translations.english:
O that my words were written down;
Would they were inscribed in a record,

translations.hebrew: בְּעֵט־בַּרְזֶ֥ל וְעֹפָ֑רֶת לָ֝עַ֗ד בַּצּ֥וּר יֵחָצְבֽוּן׃
translations.english:
Incised on a rock forever
With iron stylus and lead!

translations.hebrew: וַאֲנִ֣י יָ֭דַעְתִּי גֹּ֣אֲלִי חָ֑י וְ֝אַחֲר֗וֹן עַל־עָפָ֥ר יָקֽוּם׃
translations.english:
But I know that my Vindicator lives;
In the end He will testify on earth—

translations.hebrew: וְאַחַ֣ר ע֭וֹרִי נִקְּפוּ־זֹ֑את וּ֝מִבְּשָׂרִ֗י אֶחֱזֶ֥ה אֱלֽוֹהַּ׃
translations.english:
This, after my skin will have been peeled off.
But I would behold God while still in my flesh,

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֲנִ֨י ׀ אֶחֱזֶה־לִּ֗י וְעֵינַ֣י רָא֣וּ וְלֹא־זָ֑ר כָּל֖וּ כִלְיֹתַ֣י בְּחֵקִֽי׃
translations.english:
I myself, not another, would behold Him;
Would see with my own eyes:
My heartcLit. “kidneys.” pines within me.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֣י תֹ֭אמְרוּ מַה־נִּרְדׇּף־ל֑וֹ וְשֹׁ֥רֶשׁ דָּ֝בָ֗ר נִמְצָא־בִֽי׃
translations.english:
You say, “How do we persecute him?
The root of the matter is in him.”dWith many mss. and versions; printed editions, “me.”

translations.hebrew: גּ֤וּרוּ לָכֶ֨ם ׀ מִפְּנֵי־חֶ֗רֶב כִּֽי־חֵ֭מָה עֲוֺנ֣וֹת חָ֑רֶב לְמַ֖עַן תֵּדְע֣וּן (שדין) [שַׁדּֽוּן]׃
translations.english:
Be in fear of the sword,
For [your] fury is iniquity worthy of the sword;
Know there is a judgment!

translations.hebrew: וַ֭יַּעַן צֹפַ֥ר הַֽנַּעֲמָתִ֗י וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
translations.english: Zophar the Naamathite said in reply:

translations.hebrew: לָ֭כֵן שְׂעִפַּ֣י יְשִׁיב֑וּנִי וּ֝בַעֲב֗וּר ח֣וּשִׁי בִֽי׃
translations.english:
In truth, my thoughts urge me to answer
(It is because of my feelings

translations.hebrew: מוּסַ֣ר כְּלִמָּתִ֣י אֶשְׁמָ֑ע וְ֝ר֗וּחַ מִֽבִּינָתִ֥י יַעֲנֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
When I hear reproof that insults me);
A spirit out of my understanding makes me reply:

translations.hebrew: הֲזֹ֣את יָ֭דַעְתָּ מִנִּי־עַ֑ד מִנִּ֤י שִׂ֖ים אָדָ֣ם עֲלֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
Do you not know this, that from time immemorial,
Since man was set on earth,

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י רִנְנַ֣ת רְ֭שָׁעִים מִקָּר֑וֹב וְשִׂמְחַ֖ת חָנֵ֣ף עֲדֵי־רָֽגַע׃
translations.english:
The joy of the wicked has been brief,
The happiness of the impious, fleeting?

translations.hebrew: אִם־יַעֲלֶ֣ה לַשָּׁמַ֣יִם שִׂיא֑וֹ וְ֝רֹאשׁ֗וֹ לָעָ֥ב יַגִּֽיעַ׃
translations.english:
Though he grows as high as the sky,
His head reaching the clouds,

translations.hebrew: כְּֽ֭גֶלְלוֹ לָנֶ֣צַח יֹאבֵ֑ד רֹ֝אָ֗יו יֹאמְר֥וּ אַיּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He perishes forever, like his dung;
Those who saw him will say, “Where is he?”

translations.hebrew: כַּחֲל֣וֹם יָ֭עוּף וְלֹ֣א יִמְצָא֑וּהוּ וְ֝יֻדַּ֗ד כְּחֶזְי֥וֹן לָֽיְלָה׃
translations.english:
He flies away like a dream and cannot be found;
He is banished like a night vision.

translations.hebrew: עַ֣יִן שְׁ֭זָפַתּוּ וְלֹ֣א תוֹסִ֑יף וְלֹֽא־ע֝֗וֹד תְּשׁוּרֶ֥נּוּ מְקוֹמֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Eyes that glimpsed him do so no more;
They cannot see him in his place any longer.

translations.hebrew: בָּ֭נָיו יְרַצּ֣וּ דַלִּ֑ים וְ֝יָדָ֗יו תָּשֵׁ֥בְנָה אוֹנֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
His sons ingratiate themselves with the poor;
His own hands must give back his wealth.

translations.hebrew: עַ֭צְמוֹתָיו מָלְא֣וּ עֲלוּמָ֑ו וְ֝עִמּ֗וֹ עַל־עָפָ֥ר תִּשְׁכָּֽב׃
translations.english:
His bones, still full of vigor,
Lie down in the dust with him.

translations.hebrew: אִם־תַּמְתִּ֣יק בְּפִ֣יו רָעָ֑ה יַ֝כְחִידֶ֗נָּה תַּ֣חַת לְשֹׁנֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Though evil is sweet to his taste,
And he conceals it under his tongue;

translations.hebrew: יַחְמֹ֣ל עָ֭לֶיהָ וְלֹ֣א יַעַזְבֶ֑נָּה וְ֝יִמְנָעֶ֗נָּה בְּת֣וֹךְ חִכּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Though he saves it, does not let it go,
Holds it inside his mouth,

translations.hebrew: לַ֭חְמוֹ בְּמֵעָ֣יו נֶהְפָּ֑ךְ מְרוֹרַ֖ת פְּתָנִ֣ים בְּקִרְבּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
His food in his bowels turns
Into asps’ venom within him.

translations.hebrew: חַ֣יִל בָּ֭לַע וַיְקִאֶ֑נּוּ מִ֝בִּטְנ֗וֹ יֹרִשֶׁ֥נּוּ אֵֽל׃
translations.english:
The riches he swallows he vomits;
God empties it out of his stomach.

translations.hebrew: רֹאשׁ־פְּתָנִ֥ים יִינָ֑ק תַּ֝הַרְגֵ֗הוּ לְשׁ֣וֹן אֶפְעֶֽה׃
translations.english:
He sucks the poison of asps;
The tongue of the viper kills him.

translations.hebrew: אַל־יֵ֥רֶא בִפְלַגּ֑וֹת נַהֲרֵ֥י נַ֝חֲלֵ֗י דְּבַ֣שׁ וְחֶמְאָֽה׃
translations.english:
Let him not enjoy the streams,
The rivers of honey, the brooks of cream.

translations.hebrew: מֵשִׁ֣יב יָ֭גָע וְלֹ֣א יִבְלָ֑ע כְּחֵ֥יל תְּ֝מוּרָת֗וֹ וְלֹ֣א יַעֲלֹֽס׃
translations.english:
He will give back the goods unswallowed;
The value of the riches, undigested.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־רִ֭צַּץ עָזַ֣ב דַּלִּ֑ים בַּ֥יִת גָּ֝זַ֗ל וְלֹ֣א יִבְנֵֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
Because he crushed and tortured the poor,
He will not build up the house he took by force.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י ׀ לֹא־יָדַ֣ע שָׁלֵ֣ו בְּבִטְנ֑וֹ בַּ֝חֲמוּד֗וֹ לֹ֣א יְמַלֵּֽט׃
translations.english:
He will not see his children tranquil;
He will not preserve one of his dear ones.aFor this meaning of bet·en and ḥamud, cf. Hos. 9.16.

translations.hebrew: אֵין־שָׂרִ֥יד לְאׇכְל֑וֹ עַל־כֵּ֝֗ן לֹא־יָחִ֥יל טוּבֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
With no survivor to enjoy it,
His fortune will not prosper.

translations.hebrew: בִּמְלֹ֣אות שִׂ֭פְקוֹ יֵ֣צֶר ל֑וֹ כׇּל־יַ֖ד עָמֵ֣ל תְּבֹאֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
When he has all he wants, trouble will come;
Misfortunes of all kinds will batter him.

translations.hebrew: יְהִ֤י ׀ לְמַלֵּ֬א בִטְנ֗וֹ יְֽשַׁלַּח־בּ֭וֹ חֲר֣וֹן אַפּ֑וֹ וְיַמְטֵ֥ר עָ֝לֵ֗ימוֹ בִּלְחוּמֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Let that fill his belly;
Let Him loose His burning anger at him,
And rain down His weapons upon him.

translations.hebrew: יִ֭בְרַח מִנֵּ֣שֶׁק בַּרְזֶ֑ל תַּ֝חְלְפֵ֗הוּ קֶ֣שֶׁת נְחוּשָֽׁה׃
translations.english:
Fleeing from iron arrows,
He is shot through from a bow of bronze.

translations.hebrew: שָׁלַף֮ וַיֵּצֵ֢א מִגֵּ֫וָ֥ה וּ֭בָרָק מִֽמְּרֹרָת֥וֹ יַהֲלֹ֗ךְ עָלָ֥יו אֵמִֽים׃
translations.english:
Brandished and run through his body,
The blade, through his gall,
Strikes terror into him.

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־חֹשֶׁךְ֮ טָמ֢וּן לִצְפּ֫וּנָ֥יו תְּ֭אׇכְלֵהוּ אֵ֣שׁ לֹא־נֻפָּ֑ח יֵ֖רַע שָׂרִ֣יד בְּאׇהֳלֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Utter darkness waits for his treasured ones;
A fire fanned by no man will consume him;
Who survives in his tent will be crushed.

translations.hebrew: יְגַלּ֣וּ שָׁמַ֣יִם עֲוֺנ֑וֹ וְ֝אֶ֗רֶץ מִתְקוֹמָ֘מָ֥ה לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Heaven will expose his iniquity;
Earth will rise up against him.

translations.hebrew: יִ֭גֶל יְב֣וּל בֵּית֑וֹ נִ֝גָּר֗וֹת בְּי֣וֹם אַפּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
His household will be cast forth by a flood,
Spilled out on the day of His wrath.

translations.hebrew: זֶ֤ה ׀ חֵלֶק־אָדָ֣ם רָ֭שָׁע מֵאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְנַחֲלַ֖ת אִמְר֣וֹ מֵאֵֽל׃
translations.english:
This is the wicked man’s portion from God,
The lot God has ordained for him.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
translations.english: Job said in reply:

translations.hebrew: שִׁמְע֣וּ שָׁ֭מוֹעַ מִלָּתִ֑י וּתְהִי־זֹ֝֗את תַּנְח֥וּמֹֽתֵיכֶֽם׃
translations.english:
Listen well to what I say,
And let that be your consolation.

translations.hebrew: שָׂ֭אוּנִי וְאָנֹכִ֣י אֲדַבֵּ֑ר וְאַחַ֖ר דַּבְּרִ֣י תַלְעִֽיג׃
translations.english:
Bear with me while I speak,
And after I have spoken, you may mock.

translations.hebrew: הֶ֭אָנֹכִי לְאָדָ֣ם שִׂיחִ֑י וְאִם־מַ֝דּ֗וּעַ לֹֽא־תִקְצַ֥ר רוּחִֽי׃
translations.english:
Is my complaint directed toward a man?
Why should I not lose my patience?

translations.hebrew: פְּנוּ־אֵלַ֥י וְהָשַׁ֑מּוּ וְשִׂ֖ימוּ יָ֣ד עַל־פֶּֽה׃
translations.english:
Look at me and be appalled,
And clap your hand to your mouth.

translations.hebrew: וְאִם־זָכַ֥רְתִּי וְנִבְהָ֑לְתִּי וְאָחַ֥ז בְּ֝שָׂרִ֗י פַּלָּצֽוּת׃
translations.english:
When I think of it I am terrified;
My body is seized with shuddering.

translations.hebrew: מַ֭דּוּעַ רְשָׁעִ֣ים יִֽחְי֑וּ עָ֝תְק֗וּ גַּם־גָּ֥בְרוּ חָֽיִל׃
translations.english:
Why do the wicked live on,
Prosper and grow wealthy?

translations.hebrew: זַרְעָ֤ם נָכ֣וֹן לִפְנֵיהֶ֣ם עִמָּ֑ם וְ֝צֶאֱצָאֵיהֶ֗ם לְעֵינֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
Their children are with them always,
And they see their children’s children.

translations.hebrew: בָּתֵּיהֶ֣ם שָׁל֣וֹם מִפָּ֑חַד וְלֹ֤א שֵׁ֖בֶט אֱל֣וֹהַּ עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
Their homes are secure, without fear;
They do not feel the rod of God.

translations.hebrew: שׁוֹר֣וֹ עִ֭בַּר וְלֹ֣א יַגְעִ֑ל תְּפַלֵּ֥ט פָּ֝רָת֗וֹ וְלֹ֣א תְשַׁכֵּֽל׃
translations.english:
Their bull breeds and does not fail;
Their cow calves and never miscarries;

translations.hebrew: יְשַׁלְּח֣וּ כַ֭צֹּאן עֲוִילֵיהֶ֑ם וְ֝יַלְדֵיהֶ֗ם יְרַקֵּדֽוּן׃
translations.english:
They let their infants run loose like sheep,
And their children skip about.

translations.hebrew: יִ֭שְׂאוּ כְּתֹ֣ף וְכִנּ֑וֹר וְ֝יִשְׂמְח֗וּ לְק֣וֹל עוּגָֽב׃
translations.english:
They sing to the music of timbrel and lute,
And revel to the tune of the pipe;

translations.hebrew: (יבלו) [יְכַלּ֣וּ] בַטּ֣וֹב יְמֵיהֶ֑ם וּ֝בְרֶ֗גַע שְׁא֣וֹל יֵחָֽתּוּ׃
translations.english:
They spend their days in happiness,
And go down to Sheol in peace.

translations.hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ לָ֭אֵל ס֣וּר מִמֶּ֑נּוּ וְדַ֥עַת דְּ֝רָכֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א חָפָֽצְנוּ׃
translations.english:
They say to God, “Leave us alone,
We do not want to learn Your ways;

translations.hebrew: מַה־שַּׁדַּ֥י כִּֽי־נַעַבְדֶ֑נּוּ וּמַה־נּ֝וֹעִ֗יל כִּ֣י נִפְגַּע־בּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
What is Shaddai that we should serve Him?
What will we gain by praying to Him?”

translations.hebrew: הֵ֤ן לֹ֣א בְיָדָ֣ם טוּבָ֑ם עֲצַ֥ת רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים רָ֣חֲקָה מֶֽנִּי׃
translations.english:
Their happiness is not their own doing.
(The thoughts of the wicked are beyond me!)

translations.hebrew: כַּמָּ֤ה ׀ נֵר־רְשָׁ֘עִ֤ים יִדְעָ֗ךְ וְיָבֹ֣א עָלֵ֣ימוֹ אֵידָ֑ם חֲ֝בָלִ֗ים יְחַלֵּ֥ק בְּאַפּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
How seldom does the lamp of the wicked fail,
Does the calamity they deserve befall them,
Does He apportion [their] lot in anger!

translations.hebrew: יִֽהְי֗וּ כְּתֶ֥בֶן לִפְנֵי־ר֑וּחַ וּ֝כְמֹ֗ץ גְּנָבַ֥תּוּ סוּפָֽה׃
translations.english:
Let them become like straw in the wind,
Like chaff carried off by a storm.

translations.hebrew: אֱל֗וֹהַּ יִצְפֹּן־לְבָנָ֥יו אוֹנ֑וֹ יְשַׁלֵּ֖ם אֵלָ֣יו וְיֵדָֽע׃
translations.english:
[You say,] “God is reserving his punishment for his sons”;
Let it be paid back to him that he may feel it,

translations.hebrew: יִרְא֣וּ עֵינָ֣ו כִּיד֑וֹ וּמֵחֲמַ֖ת שַׁדַּ֣י יִשְׁתֶּֽה׃
translations.english:
Let his eyes see his ruin,
And let him drink the wrath of Shaddai!

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י מַה־חֶפְצ֣וֹ בְּבֵית֣וֹ אַחֲרָ֑יו וּמִסְפַּ֖ר חֳדָשָׁ֣יו חֻצָּֽצוּ׃
translations.english:
For what does he care about the fate of his family,
When his number of months runs out?

translations.hebrew: הַלְאֵ֥ל יְלַמֶּד־דָּ֑עַת וְ֝ה֗וּא רָמִ֥ים יִשְׁפּֽוֹט׃
translations.english:
Can God be instructed in knowledge,
He who judges from such heights?

translations.hebrew: זֶ֗ה יָ֭מוּת בְּעֶ֣צֶם תֻּמּ֑וֹ כֻּ֝לּ֗וֹ שַׁלְאֲנַ֥ן וְשָׁלֵֽיו׃
translations.english:
One man dies in robust health,
All tranquil and untroubled;

translations.hebrew: עֲ֭טִינָיו מָלְא֣וּ חָלָ֑ב וּמֹ֖חַ עַצְמוֹתָ֣יו יְשֻׁקֶּֽה׃
translations.english:
His pails are full of milk;
The marrow of his bones is juicy.

translations.hebrew: וְזֶ֗ה יָ֭מוּת בְּנֶ֣פֶשׁ מָרָ֑ה וְלֹֽא־אָ֝כַ֗ל בַּטּוֹבָֽה׃
translations.english:
Another dies embittered,
Never having tasted happiness.

translations.hebrew: יַ֭חַד עַל־עָפָ֣ר יִשְׁכָּ֑בוּ וְ֝רִמָּ֗ה תְּכַסֶּ֥ה עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
They both lie in the dust
And are covered with worms.

translations.hebrew: הֵ֣ן יָ֭דַעְתִּי מַחְשְׁבֽוֹתֵיכֶ֑ם וּ֝מְזִמּ֗וֹת עָלַ֥י תַּחְמֹֽסוּ׃
translations.english:
Oh, I know your thoughts,
And the tactics you will devise against me.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י תֹאמְר֗וּ אַיֵּ֥ה בֵית־נָדִ֑יב וְ֝אַיֵּ֗ה אֹ֤הֶל ׀ מִשְׁכְּנ֬וֹת רְשָׁעִֽים׃
translations.english:
You will say, “Where is the house of the great man—
And where the tent in which the wicked dwelled?”

translations.hebrew: הֲלֹ֣א שְׁ֭אֶלְתֶּם ע֣וֹבְרֵי דָ֑רֶךְ וְ֝אֹתֹתָ֗ם לֹ֣א תְנַכֵּֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
You must have consulted the wayfarers;
You cannot deny their evidence.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י לְי֣וֹם אֵ֭יד יֵחָ֣שֶׂךְ רָ֑ע לְי֖וֹם עֲבָר֣וֹת יוּבָֽלוּ׃
translations.english:
For the evil man is spared on the day of calamity,
On the day when wrath is led forth.

translations.hebrew: מִֽי־יַגִּ֣יד עַל־פָּנָ֣יו דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וְהוּא־עָ֝שָׂ֗ה מִ֣י יְשַׁלֶּם־לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Who will upbraid him to his face?
Who will requite him for what he has done?

translations.hebrew: וְ֭הוּא לִקְבָר֣וֹת יוּבָ֑ל וְֽעַל־גָּדִ֥ישׁ יִשְׁקֽוֹד׃
translations.english:
He is brought to the grave,
While a watch is kept at his tomb.

translations.hebrew: מָֽתְקוּ־ל֗וֹ רִגְבֵ֫י־נָ֥חַל וְ֭אַחֲרָיו כׇּל־אָדָ֣ם יִמְשׁ֑וֹךְ וּ֝לְפָנָ֗יו אֵ֣ין מִסְפָּֽר׃
translations.english:
The clods of the wadi are sweet to him,
Everyone follows behind him,
Innumerable are those who precede him.

translations.hebrew: וְ֭אֵיךְ תְּנַחֲמ֣וּנִי הָ֑בֶל וּ֝תְשׁ֥וּבֹתֵיכֶ֗ם נִשְׁאַר־מָֽעַל׃
translations.english:
Why then do you offer me empty consolation?
Of your replies only the perfidy remains.

translations.hebrew: וַ֭יַּעַן אֱלִיפַ֥ז הַֽתֵּמָנִ֗י וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
translations.english: Eliphaz the Temanite said in reply:

translations.hebrew: הַלְאֵ֥ל יִסְכׇּן־גָּ֑בֶר כִּֽי־יִסְכֹּ֖ן עָלֵ֣ימוֹ מַשְׂכִּֽיל׃
translations.english:
Can a man be of use to God,
A wise man benefit Him?

translations.hebrew: הַחֵ֣פֶץ לְ֭שַׁדַּי כִּ֣י תִצְדָּ֑ק וְאִם־בֶּ֝֗צַע כִּֽי־תַתֵּ֥ם דְּרָכֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Does Shaddai gain if you are righteous?
Does He profit if your conduct is blameless?

translations.hebrew: הֲֽ֭מִיִּרְאָ֣תְךָ יֹכִיחֶ֑ךָ יָב֥וֹא עִ֝מְּךָ֗ בַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
translations.english:
Is it because of your piety that He arraigns you,
And enters into judgment with you?

translations.hebrew: הֲלֹ֣א רָעָתְךָ֣ רַבָּ֑ה וְאֵֽין־קֵ֝֗ץ לַעֲוֺנֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
You know that your wickedness is great,
And that your iniquities have no limit.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־תַחְבֹּ֣ל אַחֶ֣יךָ חִנָּ֑ם וּבִגְדֵ֖י עֲרוּמִּ֣ים תַּפְשִֽׁיט׃
translations.english:
You exact pledges from your fellows without reason,
And leave them naked, stripped of their clothes;

translations.hebrew: לֹא־מַ֭יִם עָיֵ֣ף תַּשְׁקֶ֑ה וּ֝מֵרָעֵ֗ב תִּֽמְנַֽע־לָֽחֶם׃
translations.english:
You do not give the thirsty water to drink;
You deny bread to the hungry.

translations.hebrew: וְאִ֣ישׁ זְ֭רוֹעַ ל֣וֹ הָאָ֑רֶץ וּנְשׂ֥וּא פָ֝נִ֗ים יֵ֣שֶׁב בָּֽהּ׃
translations.english:
The land belongs to the strong;
The privileged occupy it.

translations.hebrew: אַ֭לְמָנוֹת שִׁלַּ֣חְתָּ רֵיקָ֑ם וּזְרֹע֖וֹת יְתֹמִ֣ים יְדֻכָּֽא׃
translations.english:
You have sent away widows empty-handed;
The strength of the fatherless is broken.

translations.hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֭ן סְבִיבוֹתֶ֣יךָ פַחִ֑ים וִ֝יבַהֶלְךָ֗ פַּ֣חַד פִּתְאֹֽם׃
translations.english:
Therefore snares are all around you,
And sudden terrors frighten you,

translations.hebrew: אוֹ־חֹ֥שֶׁךְ לֹֽא־תִרְאֶ֑ה וְֽשִׁפְעַת־מַ֥יִם תְּכַסֶּֽךָּ׃
translations.english:
Or darkness, so you cannot see;
A flood of waters covers you.

translations.hebrew: הֲֽלֹא־אֱ֭לוֹהַּ גֹּ֣בַהּ שָׁמָ֑יִם וּרְאֵ֤ה רֹ֖אשׁ כּוֹכָבִ֣ים כִּי־רָֽמּוּ׃
translations.english:
God is in the heavenly heights;
See the highest stars, how lofty!

translations.hebrew: וְֽ֭אָמַרְתָּ מַה־יָּ֣דַֽע אֵ֑ל הַבְעַ֖ד עֲרָפֶ֣ל יִשְׁפּֽוֹט׃
translations.english:
You say, “What can God know?
Can He govern through the dense cloud?

translations.hebrew: עָבִ֣ים סֵֽתֶר־ל֭וֹ וְלֹ֣א יִרְאֶ֑ה וְח֥וּג שָׁ֝מַ֗יִם יִתְהַלָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
The clouds screen Him so He cannot see
As He moves about the circuit of heaven.”

translations.hebrew: הַאֹ֣רַח עוֹלָ֣ם תִּשְׁמ֑וֹר אֲשֶׁ֖ר דָּרְכ֣וּ מְתֵי־אָֽוֶן׃
translations.english:
Have you observed the immemorial path
That evil men have trodden;

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶֽׁר־קֻמְּט֥וּ וְלֹא־עֵ֑ת נָ֝הָ֗ר יוּצַ֥ק יְסוֹדָֽם׃
translations.english:
How they were shriveled up before their time
And their foundation poured out like a river?

translations.hebrew: הָאֹמְרִ֣ים לָ֭אֵל ס֣וּר מִמֶּ֑נּוּ וּמַה־יִּפְעַ֖ל שַׁדַּ֣י לָֽמוֹ׃
translations.english:
They said to God, “Leave us alone;
What can Shaddai do about it?”

translations.hebrew: וְה֤וּא מִלֵּ֣א בָתֵּיהֶ֣ם ט֑וֹב וַעֲצַ֥ת רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים רָ֣חֲקָה מֶֽנִּי׃
translations.english:
But it was He who filled their houses with good things.
(The thoughts of the wicked are beyond me!)

translations.hebrew: יִרְא֣וּ צַדִּיקִ֣ים וְיִשְׂמָ֑חוּ וְ֝נָקִ֗י יִלְעַג־לָֽמוֹ׃
translations.english:
The righteous, seeing it,aReferring to v. 16. rejoiced;
The innocent laughed with scorn.

translations.hebrew: אִם־לֹ֣א נִכְחַ֣ד קִימָ֑נוּ וְ֝יִתְרָ֗ם אָ֣כְלָה אֵֽשׁ׃
translations.english:
Surely their substance was destroyed,
And their remnant consumed by fire.

translations.hebrew: הַסְכֶּן־נָ֣א עִמּ֣וֹ וּשְׁלָ֑ם בָּ֝הֶ֗ם תְּֽבוֹאַתְךָ֥ טוֹבָֽה׃
translations.english:
Be close to Him and wholehearted;
Good things will come to you thereby.

translations.hebrew: קַח־נָ֣א מִפִּ֣יו תּוֹרָ֑ה וְשִׂ֥ים אֲ֝מָרָ֗יו בִּלְבָבֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Accept instruction from His mouth;
Lay up His words in your heart.

translations.hebrew: אִם־תָּשׁ֣וּב עַד־שַׁ֭דַּי תִּבָּנֶ֑ה תַּֽרְחִ֥יק עַ֝וְלָ֗ה מֵאׇהֳלֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
If you return to Shaddai you will be restored,
If you banish iniquity from your tent;

translations.hebrew: וְשִׁית־עַל־עָפָ֥ר בָּ֑צֶר וּכְצ֖וּר נְחָלִ֣ים אוֹפִֽיר׃
translations.english:
If you regard treasure as dirt,
Ophir-gold as stones of the wadi,

translations.hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה שַׁדַּ֣י בְּצָרֶ֑יךָ וְכֶ֖סֶף תּוֹעָפ֣וֹת לָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
And Shaddai be your treasure
And precious silver for you,

translations.hebrew: כִּי־אָ֭ז עַל־שַׁדַּ֣י תִּתְעַנָּ֑ג וְתִשָּׂ֖א אֶל־אֱל֣וֹהַּ פָּנֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
When you seek the favor of Shaddai,
And lift up your face to God,

translations.hebrew: תַּעְתִּ֣יר אֵ֭לָיו וְיִשְׁמָעֶ֑ךָּ וּנְדָרֶ֥יךָ תְשַׁלֵּֽם׃
translations.english:
You will pray to Him, and He will listen to you,
And you will pay your vows.

translations.hebrew: וְֽתִגְזַר־אֹ֭מֶר וְיָ֣קׇם־לָ֑ךְ וְעַל־דְּ֝רָכֶ֗יךָ נָ֣גַהּ אֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
You will decree and it will be fulfilled,
And light will shine upon your affairs.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־הִ֭שְׁפִּילוּ וַתֹּ֣אמֶר גֵּוָ֑ה וְשַׁ֖ח עֵינַ֣יִם יוֹשִֽׁעַ׃
translations.english:
When others sink low, you will say it is pride;
For He saves the humble.

translations.hebrew: יְמַלֵּ֥ט אִֽי־נָקִ֑י וְ֝נִמְלַ֗ט בְּבֹ֣ר כַּפֶּֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
He will deliver the guilty;
He will be delivered through the cleanness of your hands.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
translations.english: Job said in reply:

translations.hebrew: גַּם־הַ֭יּוֹם מְרִ֣י שִׂחִ֑י יָ֝דִ֗י כָּבְדָ֥ה עַל־אַנְחָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
Today again my complaint is bitter;
aLit. “My hand is heavy.”My strength is spent-a on account of my groaning.

translations.hebrew: מִֽי־יִתֵּ֣ן יָ֭דַעְתִּי וְאֶמְצָאֵ֑הוּ אָ֝ב֗וֹא עַד־תְּכוּנָתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Would that I knew how to reach Him,
How to get to His dwelling-place.

translations.hebrew: אֶעֶרְכָ֣ה לְפָנָ֣יו מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּ֝פִ֗י אֲמַלֵּ֥א תוֹכָחֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
I would set out my case before Him
And fill my mouth with arguments.

translations.hebrew: אֵ֭דְעָה מִלִּ֣ים יַעֲנֵ֑נִי וְ֝אָבִ֗ינָה מַה־יֹּ֥אמַר לִֽי׃
translations.english:
I would learn what answers He had for me
And know how He would reply to me.

translations.hebrew: הַבְּרׇב־כֹּ֭חַ יָרִ֣יב עִמָּדִ֑י לֹ֥א אַךְ־ה֝֗וּא יָשִׂ֥ם בִּֽי׃
translations.english:
Would He contend with me overbearingly?
Surely He would not accuse me!

translations.hebrew: שָׁ֗ם יָ֭שָׁר נוֹכָ֣ח עִמּ֑וֹ וַאֲפַלְּטָ֥ה לָ֝נֶ֗צַח מִשֹּׁפְטִֽי׃
translations.english:
There the upright would be cleared by Him,
And I would escape forever from my judge.

translations.hebrew: הֵ֤ן קֶ֣דֶם אֶהֱלֹ֣ךְ וְאֵינֶ֑נּוּ וְ֝אָח֗וֹר וְֽלֹא־אָבִ֥ין לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
But if I go East—He is not there;
West—I still do not perceive Him;

translations.hebrew: שְׂמֹ֣אול בַּעֲשֹׂת֣וֹ וְלֹא־אָ֑חַז יַעְטֹ֥ף יָ֝מִ֗ין וְלֹ֣א אֶרְאֶֽה׃
translations.english:
North—since He is concealed, I do not behold Him;
South—He is hidden, and I cannot see Him.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־יָ֭דַע דֶּ֣רֶךְ עִמָּדִ֑י בְּ֝חָנַ֗נִי כַּזָּהָ֥ב אֵצֵֽא׃
translations.english:
But He knows the way I take;
Would He assay me, I should emerge pure as gold.

translations.hebrew: בַּ֭אֲשֻׁרוֹ אָחֲזָ֣ה רַגְלִ֑י דַּרְכּ֖וֹ שָׁמַ֣רְתִּי וְלֹא־אָֽט׃
translations.english:
I have followed in His tracks,
Kept His way without swerving,

translations.hebrew: מִצְוַ֣ת שְׂ֭פָתָיו וְלֹ֣א אָמִ֑ישׁ מֵ֝חֻקִּ֗י צָפַ֥נְתִּי אִמְרֵי־פִֽיו׃
translations.english:
I have not deviated from what His lips commanded;
I have treasured His words more than my daily bread.

translations.hebrew: וְה֣וּא בְ֭אֶחָד וּמִ֣י יְשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ וְנַפְשׁ֖וֹ אִוְּתָ֣ה וַיָּֽעַשׂ׃
translations.english:
He is one; who can dissuade Him?
Whatever He desires, He does.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֭י יַשְׁלִ֣ים חֻקִּ֑י וְכָהֵ֖נָּה רַבּ֣וֹת עִמּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
For He will bring my term to an end,
But He has many more such at His disposal.

translations.hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֭ן מִפָּנָ֣יו אֶבָּהֵ֑ל אֶ֝תְבּוֹנֵ֗ן וְאֶפְחַ֥ד מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
Therefore I am terrified at His presence;
When I consider, I dread Him.

translations.hebrew: וְ֭אֵל הֵרַ֣ךְ לִבִּ֑י וְ֝שַׁדַּ֗י הִבְהִילָֽנִי׃
translations.english:
God has made me fainthearted;
Shaddai has terrified me.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־לֹ֣א נִ֭צְמַתִּי מִפְּנֵי־חֹ֑שֶׁךְ וּ֝מִפָּנַ֗י כִּסָּה־אֹֽפֶל׃
translations.english:
Yet I am not cut off by the darkness;
He has concealed the thick gloom from me.

translations.hebrew: מַדּ֗וּעַ מִ֭שַּׁדַּי לֹא־נִצְפְּנ֣וּ עִתִּ֑ים וְ֝יֹדְעָ֗ו לֹא־חָ֥זוּ יָמָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Why are times for judgment not reserved by Shaddai?
Even those close to Him cannot foresee His actions.aLit. “days.”

translations.hebrew: גְּבֻל֥וֹת יַשִּׂ֑יגוּ עֵ֥דֶר גָּ֝זְל֗וּ וַיִּרְעֽוּ׃
translations.english:
People remove boundary-stones;
They carry off flocks and pasture them;

translations.hebrew: חֲמ֣וֹר יְתוֹמִ֣ים יִנְהָ֑גוּ יַ֝חְבְּל֗וּ שׁ֣וֹר אַלְמָנָֽה׃
translations.english:
They lead away the donkeys of the fatherless,
And seize the widow’s bull as a pledge;

translations.hebrew: יַטּ֣וּ אֶבְיֹנִ֣ים מִדָּ֑רֶךְ יַ֥חַד חֻ֝בְּא֗וּ עֲנִיֵּי־אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
They chase the needy off the roads;
All the poor of the land are forced into hiding.

translations.hebrew: הֵ֤ן פְּרָאִ֨ים ׀ בַּ֥מִּדְבָּ֗ר יָצְא֣וּ בְּ֭פׇעֳלָם מְשַׁחֲרֵ֣י לַטָּ֑רֶף עֲרָבָ֥ה ל֥וֹ לֶ֝֗חֶם לַנְּעָרִֽים׃
translations.english:
Like the wild asses of the wilderness,
They go about their tasks, seeking food;
The wilderness provides each with food for his lads;

translations.hebrew: בַּ֭שָּׂדֶה בְּלִיל֣וֹ (יקצירו) [יִקְצ֑וֹרוּ] וְכֶ֖רֶם רָשָׁ֣ע יְלַקֵּֽשׁוּ׃
translations.english:
They harvest fodder in the field,
And glean the late grapes in the vineyards of the wicked.

translations.hebrew: עָר֣וֹם יָ֭לִינוּ מִבְּלִ֣י לְב֑וּשׁ וְאֵ֥ין כְּ֝ס֗וּת בַּקָּרָֽה׃
translations.english:
They pass the night naked for lack of clothing,
They have no covering against the cold;

translations.hebrew: מִזֶּ֣רֶם הָרִ֣ים יִרְטָ֑בוּ וּֽמִבְּלִ֥י מַ֝חְסֶ֗ה חִבְּקוּ־צֽוּר׃
translations.english:
They are drenched by the mountain rains,
And huddle against the rock for lack of shelter.

translations.hebrew: יִ֭גְזְלוּ מִשֹּׁ֣ד יָת֑וֹם וְֽעַל־עָנִ֥י יַחְבֹּֽלוּ׃
translations.english:
bThis verse belongs to the description of the wicked in vv. 2–4a.They snatch the fatherless infant from the breast,
And seize the child of the poor as a pledge.

translations.hebrew: עָר֣וֹם הִ֭לְּכוּ בְּלִ֣י לְב֑וּשׁ וּ֝רְעֵבִ֗ים נָ֣שְׂאוּ עֹֽמֶר׃
translations.english:
They go about naked for lack of clothing,
And, hungry, carry sheaves;

translations.hebrew: בֵּין־שׁוּרֹתָ֥ם יַצְהִ֑ירוּ יְקָבִ֥ים דָּ֝רְכ֗וּ וַיִּצְמָֽאוּ׃
translations.english:
Between rows [of olive trees] they make oil,
And, thirsty, they tread the winepresses.

translations.hebrew: מֵ֘עִ֤יר מְתִ֨ים ׀ יִנְאָ֗קוּ וְנֶֽפֶשׁ־חֲלָלִ֥ים תְּשַׁוֵּ֑עַ וֶ֝אֱל֗וֹהַּ לֹֽא־יָשִׂ֥ים תִּפְלָֽה׃
translations.english:
Men groan in the city;
The souls of the dying cry out;
Yet God does not regard it as a reproach.

translations.hebrew: הֵ֤מָּה ׀ הָיוּ֮ בְּֽמֹרְדֵ֫י־א֥וֹר לֹא־הִכִּ֥ירוּ דְרָכָ֑יו וְלֹ֥א יָ֝שְׁב֗וּ בִּנְתִיבֹתָֽיו׃
translations.english:
They are rebels against the light;
They are strangers to its ways,
And do not stay in its path.

translations.hebrew: לָא֡וֹר יָ֘ק֤וּם רוֹצֵ֗חַ יִֽקְטׇל־עָנִ֥י וְאֶבְי֑וֹן וּ֝בַלַּ֗יְלָה יְהִ֣י כַגַּנָּֽב׃
translations.english:
The murderer arises cCf. Mishnaic Heb. ‘or, Aramaic ‘orta, “evening”; others “with the light.”in the evening-c
To kill the poor and needy,
And at night he acts the thief.

translations.hebrew: וְעֵ֤ין נֹאֵ֨ף ׀ שָׁ֤מְרָֽה־נֶ֣שֶׁף לֵ֭אמֹר לֹא־תְשׁוּרֵ֣נִי עָ֑יִן וְסֵ֖תֶר פָּנִ֣ים יָשִֽׂים׃
translations.english:
The eyes of the adulterer watch for twilight,
Thinking, “No one will glimpse me then.”
He masks his face.

translations.hebrew: חָתַ֥ר בַּחֹ֗שֶׁךְ בָּ֫תִּ֥ים יוֹמָ֥ם חִתְּמוּ־לָ֗מוֹ לֹא־יָ֥דְעוּ אֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
In the dark they break into houses;
By day they shut themselves in;
They do not know the light.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י יַחְדָּ֨ו ׀ בֹּ֣קֶר לָ֣מוֹ צַלְמָ֑וֶת כִּֽי־יַ֝כִּ֗יר בַּלְה֥וֹת צַלְמָֽוֶת׃
translations.english:
For all of them morning is darkness;
It is then that they discern the terror of darkness.

translations.hebrew: קַל־ה֤וּא ׀ עַל־פְּנֵי־מַ֗יִם תְּקֻלַּ֣ל חֶלְקָתָ֣ם בָּאָ֑רֶץ לֹא־יִ֝פְנֶ֗ה דֶּ֣רֶךְ כְּרָמִֽים׃
translations.english:
dFrom here to the end of the chapter the translation is largely conjectural.May they be flotsam on the face of the water;
May their portion in the land be cursed;
May none turn aside by way of their vineyards.

translations.hebrew: צִיָּ֤ה גַם־חֹ֗ם יִגְזְל֥וּ מֵֽימֵי־שֶׁ֗לֶג שְׁא֣וֹל חָטָֽאוּ׃
translations.english:
May drought and heat snatch away their snow waters,
And Sheol, those who have sinned.

translations.hebrew: יִשְׁכָּ֘חֵ֤הוּ רֶ֨חֶם ׀ מְתָ֘ק֤וֹ רִמָּ֗ה ע֥וֹד לֹֽא־יִזָּכֵ֑ר וַתִּשָּׁבֵ֖ר כָּעֵ֣ץ עַוְלָֽה׃
translations.english:
May the womb forget him;
May he be sweet to the worms;
May he be no longer remembered;
May wrongdoers be broken like a tree.

translations.hebrew: רֹעֶ֣ה עֲ֭קָרָה לֹ֣א תֵלֵ֑ד וְ֝אַלְמָנָ֗ה לֹ֣א יְיֵטִֽיב׃
translations.english:
May he consort with a barren woman who bears no child,
Leave his widow deprived of good.

translations.hebrew: וּמָשַׁ֣ךְ אַבִּירִ֣ים בְּכֹח֑וֹ יָ֝ק֗וּם וְֽלֹא־יַאֲמִ֥ין בַּחַיִּֽין׃
translations.english:
Though he has the strength to seize bulls,
May he live with no assurance of survival.

translations.hebrew: יִתֶּן־ל֣וֹ לָ֭בֶטַח וְיִשָּׁעֵ֑ן וְ֝עֵינֵ֗יהוּ עַל־דַּרְכֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
Yet [God] gives him the security on which he relies,
And keeps watch over his affairs.

translations.hebrew: ר֤וֹמּוּ מְּעַ֨ט ׀ וְֽאֵינֶ֗נּוּ וְֽהֻמְּכ֗וּ כַּכֹּ֥ל יִקָּפְצ֑וּן וּכְרֹ֖אשׁ שִׁבֹּ֣לֶת יִמָּֽלוּ׃
translations.english:
Exalted for a while, let them be gone;
Be brought low, and shrivel like mallows,
And wither like the heads of grain.

translations.hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֣א אֵ֭פוֹ מִ֣י יַכְזִיבֵ֑נִי וְיָשֵׂ֥ם לְ֝אַ֗ל מִלָּתִֽי׃
translations.english:
Surely no one can confute me,
Or prove that I am wrong.

translations.hebrew: וַ֭יַּעַן בִּלְדַּ֥ד הַשֻּׁחִ֗י וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
translations.english: Bildad the Shuhite said in reply:

translations.hebrew: הַמְשֵׁ֣ל וָפַ֣חַד עִמּ֑וֹ עֹשֶׂ֥ה שָׁ֝ל֗וֹם בִּמְרוֹמָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Dominion and dread are His;
He imposes peace in His heights.

translations.hebrew: הֲיֵ֣שׁ מִ֭סְפָּר לִגְדוּדָ֑יו וְעַל־מִ֝֗י לֹא־יָק֥וּם אוֹרֵֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
Can His troops be numbered?
On whom does His light not shine?

translations.hebrew: וּמַה־יִּצְדַּ֣ק אֱנ֣וֹשׁ עִם־אֵ֑ל וּמַה־יִּ֝זְכֶּ֗ה יְל֣וּד אִשָּֽׁה׃
translations.english:
How can man be in the right before God?
How can one born of woman be cleared of guilt?

translations.hebrew: הֵ֣ן עַד־יָ֭רֵחַ וְלֹ֣א יַאֲהִ֑יל וְ֝כוֹכָבִ֗ים לֹא־זַכּ֥וּ בְעֵינָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Even the moon is not bright,
And the stars are not pure in His sight.

translations.hebrew: אַ֭ף כִּֽי־אֱנ֣וֹשׁ רִמָּ֑ה וּבֶן־אָ֝דָ֗ם תּוֹלֵעָֽה׃
translations.english:
How much less man, a worm,
The son-of-man, a maggot.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
translations.english: Then Job said in reply:

translations.hebrew: מֶה־עָזַ֥רְתָּ לְלֹא־כֹ֑חַ ה֝וֹשַׁ֗עְתָּ זְר֣וֹעַ לֹא־עֹֽז׃
translations.english:
You would help without having the strength;
You would deliver with arms that have no power.

translations.hebrew: מַה־יָּ֭עַצְתָּ לְלֹ֣א חׇכְמָ֑ה וְ֝תֻשִׁיָּ֗ה לָרֹ֥ב הוֹדָֽעְתָּ׃
translations.english:
Without having the wisdom, you offer advice
And freely give your counsel.

translations.hebrew: אֶת־מִ֭י הִגַּ֣דְתָּ מִלִּ֑ין וְנִשְׁמַת־מִ֝֗י יָצְאָ֥ה מִמֶּֽךָּ׃
translations.english:
To whom have you addressed words?
Whose breath issued from you?

translations.hebrew: הָרְפָאִ֥ים יְחוֹלָ֑לוּ מִתַּ֥חַת מַ֝֗יִם וְשֹׁכְנֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
The shades tremble
Beneath the waters and their denizens.

translations.hebrew: עָר֣וֹם שְׁא֣וֹל נֶגְדּ֑וֹ וְאֵ֥ין כְּ֝ס֗וּת לָאֲבַדּֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
Sheol is naked before Him;
Abaddon has no cover.

translations.hebrew: נֹטֶ֣ה צָפ֣וֹן עַל־תֹּ֑הוּ תֹּ֥לֶה אֶ֝֗רֶץ עַל־בְּלִי־מָֽה׃
translations.english:
He it is who stretched out ZaphonaUsed for heaven; cf. Isa. 14.13; Ps. 48.3. over chaos,
Who suspended earth over emptiness.

translations.hebrew: צֹרֵֽר־מַ֥יִם בְּעָבָ֑יו וְלֹֽא־נִבְקַ֖ע עָנָ֣ן תַּחְתָּֽם׃
translations.english:
He wrapped up the waters in His clouds;
Yet no cloud burst under their weight.

translations.hebrew: מְאַחֵ֥ז פְּנֵֽי־כִסֵּ֑ה פַּרְשֵׁ֖ז עָלָ֣יו עֲנָנֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.He shuts off the view of His throne,
Spreading His cloud over it.-b

translations.hebrew: חֹֽק־חָ֭ג עַל־פְּנֵי־מָ֑יִם עַד־תַּכְלִ֖ית א֣וֹר עִם־חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃
translations.english:
He drew a boundary on the surface of the waters,
At the extreme where light and darkness meet.

translations.hebrew: עַמּוּדֵ֣י שָׁמַ֣יִם יְרוֹפָ֑פוּ וְ֝יִתְמְה֗וּ מִגַּעֲרָתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The pillars of heaven tremble,
Astounded at His blast.

translations.hebrew: בְּ֭כֹחוֹ רָגַ֣ע הַיָּ֑ם (ובתובנתו) [וּ֝בִתְבוּנָת֗וֹ] מָ֣חַץ רָֽהַב׃
translations.english:
By His power He stilled the sea;
By His skill He struck down Rahab.

translations.hebrew: בְּ֭רוּחוֹ שָׁמַ֣יִם שִׁפְרָ֑ה חֹלְלָ֥ה יָ֝ד֗וֹ נָחָ֥שׁ בָּרִֽחַ׃
translations.english:
By His wind the heavens were calmed;
His hand pierced the cCf. Isa. 27.1.Elusive Serpent.-c

translations.hebrew: הֶן־אֵ֤לֶּה ׀ קְצ֬וֹת דְּרָכָ֗ו וּמַה־שֵּׁ֣מֶץ דָּ֭בָר נִשְׁמַע־בּ֑וֹ וְרַ֥עַם גְּ֝בוּרֹתָ֗ו מִ֣י יִתְבּוֹנָֽן׃
translations.english:
These are but glimpses of His rule,
The mere whisper that we perceive of Him;
Who can absorb the thunder of His mighty deeds?

translations.hebrew: וַיֹּ֣סֶף אִ֭יּוֹב שְׂאֵ֥ת מְשָׁל֗וֹ וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
translations.english: Job again took up his theme and said:

translations.hebrew: חַי־אֵ֭ל הֵסִ֣יר מִשְׁפָּטִ֑י וְ֝שַׁדַּ֗י הֵמַ֥ר נַפְשִֽׁי׃
translations.english:
By God who has deprived me of justice!
By Shaddai who has embittered my life!

translations.hebrew: כִּי־כׇל־ע֣וֹד נִשְׁמָתִ֣י בִ֑י וְר֖וּחַ אֱל֣וֹהַּ בְּאַפִּֽי׃
translations.english:
As long as there is life in me,
And God’s breath is in my nostrils,

translations.hebrew: אִם־תְּדַבֵּ֣רְנָה שְׂפָתַ֣י עַוְלָ֑ה וּ֝לְשׁוֹנִ֗י אִם־יֶהְגֶּ֥ה רְמִיָּֽה׃
translations.english:
My lips will speak no wrong,
Nor my tongue utter deceit.

translations.hebrew: חָלִ֣ילָה לִּי֮ אִם־אַצְדִּ֢יק אֶ֫תְכֶ֥ם עַד־אֶגְוָ֑ע לֹֽא־אָסִ֖יר תֻּמָּתִ֣י מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
translations.english:
Far be it from me to say you are right;
Until I die I will maintain my integrity.

translations.hebrew: בְּצִדְקָתִ֣י הֶ֭חֱזַקְתִּי וְלֹ֣א אַרְפֶּ֑הָ לֹא־יֶחֱרַ֥ף לְ֝בָבִ֗י מִיָּמָֽי׃
translations.english:
I persist in my righteousness and will not yield;
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.I shall be free of reproach-a as long as I live.

translations.hebrew: יְהִ֣י כְ֭רָשָׁע אֹ֣יְבִ֑י וּמִתְקוֹמְמִ֥י כְעַוָּֽל׃
translations.english:
May my enemy be as the wicked;
My assailant, as the wrongdoer.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י מַה־תִּקְוַ֣ת חָ֭נֵף כִּ֣י יִבְצָ֑ע כִּ֤י יֵ֖שֶׁל אֱל֣וֹהַּ נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
translations.english:
For what hope has the impious man when he is cut down,
When God takes away his life?

translations.hebrew: הֲֽ֭צַעֲקָתוֹ יִשְׁמַ֥ע <small>׀</small> אֵ֑ל כִּֽי־תָב֖וֹא עָלָ֣יו צָרָֽה׃
translations.english:
Will God hear his cry
When trouble comes upon him,

translations.hebrew: אִם־עַל־שַׁדַּ֥י יִתְעַנָּ֑ג יִקְרָ֖א אֱל֣וֹהַּ בְּכׇל־עֵֽת׃
translations.english:
When he seeks the favor of Shaddai,
Calls upon God at all times?

translations.hebrew: אוֹרֶ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֣ם בְּיַד־אֵ֑ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר עִם־שַׁ֝דַּ֗י לֹ֣א אֲכַחֵֽד׃
translations.english:
I will teach you what is in God’s power,
And what is with Shaddai I will not conceal.

translations.hebrew: הֵן־אַתֶּ֣ם כֻּלְּכֶ֣ם חֲזִיתֶ֑ם וְלָמָּה־זֶּ֝֗ה הֶ֣בֶל תֶּהְבָּֽלוּ׃
translations.english:
All of you have seen it,
So why talk nonsense?

translations.hebrew: זֶ֤ה ׀ חֵלֶק־אָדָ֖ם רָשָׁ֥ע ׀ עִם־אֵ֑ל וְֽנַחֲלַ֥ת עָ֝רִיצִ֗ים מִשַּׁדַּ֥י יִקָּֽחוּ׃
translations.english:
This is the evil man’s portion from God,
The lot that the ruthless receive from Shaddai:

translations.hebrew: אִם־יִרְבּ֣וּ בָנָ֣יו לְמוֹ־חָ֑רֶב וְ֝צֶאֱצָאָ֗יו לֹ֣א יִשְׂבְּעוּ־לָֽחֶם׃
translations.english:
Should he have many sons—they are marked for the sword;
His descendants will never have their fill of bread;

translations.hebrew: שְׂ֭רִידָו בַּמָּ֣וֶת יִקָּבֵ֑רוּ וְ֝אַלְמְנֹתָ֗יו לֹ֣א תִבְכֶּֽינָה׃
translations.english:
Those who survive him will be buried in a plague,
And their widows will not weep;

translations.hebrew: אִם־יִצְבֹּ֣ר כֶּעָפָ֣ר כָּ֑סֶף וְ֝כַחֹ֗מֶר יָכִ֥ין מַלְבּֽוּשׁ׃
translations.english:
Should he pile up silver like dust,
Lay up clothing like dirt—

translations.hebrew: יָ֭כִין וְצַדִּ֣יק יִלְבָּ֑שׁ וְ֝כֶ֗סֶף נָקִ֥י יַחֲלֹֽק׃
translations.english:
He may lay it up, but the righteous will wear it,
And the innocent will share the silver.

translations.hebrew: בָּנָ֣ה כָעָ֣שׁ בֵּית֑וֹ וּ֝כְסֻכָּ֗ה עָשָׂ֥ה נֹצֵֽר׃
translations.english:
The house he built is like a bird’s nest,
Like the booth a watchman makes.

translations.hebrew: עָשִׁ֣יר יִ֭שְׁכַּב וְלֹ֣א יֵאָסֵ֑ף עֵינָ֖יו פָּקַ֣ח וְאֵינֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
He lies down, a rich man, with [his wealth] intact;
When he opens his eyes it is gone.

translations.hebrew: תַּשִּׂיגֵ֣הוּ כַ֭מַּיִם בַּלָּה֑וֹת לַ֝֗יְלָה גְּנָבַ֥תּוּ סוּפָֽה׃
translations.english:
Terror overtakes him like a flood;
A storm wind makes off with him by night.

translations.hebrew: יִשָּׂאֵ֣הוּ קָדִ֣ים וְיֵלַ֑ךְ וִ֝ישָׂעֲרֵ֗הוּ מִמְּקֹמֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The east wind carries him far away, and he is gone;
It sweeps him from his place.

translations.hebrew: וְיַשְׁלֵ֣ךְ עָ֭לָיו וְלֹ֣א יַחְמֹ֑ל מִ֝יָּד֗וֹ בָּר֥וֹחַ יִבְרָֽח׃
translations.english:
Then it hurls itself at him without mercy;
He tries to escape from its force.

translations.hebrew: יִשְׂפֹּ֣ק עָלֵ֣ימוֹ כַפֵּ֑ימוֹ וְיִשְׁרֹ֥ק עָ֝לָ֗יו מִמְּקֹמֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
It claps its hands at him,
And whistles at him from its place.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י יֵ֣שׁ לַכֶּ֣סֶף מוֹצָ֑א וּ֝מָק֗וֹם לַזָּהָ֥ב יָזֹֽקּוּ׃
translations.english:
There is a mine for silver,
And a place where gold is refined.

translations.hebrew: בַּ֭רְזֶל מֵעָפָ֣ר יֻקָּ֑ח וְ֝אֶ֗בֶן יָצ֥וּק נְחוּשָֽׁה׃
translations.english:
Iron is taken out of the earth,
And copper smelted from rock.

translations.hebrew: קֵ֤ץ ׀ שָׂ֤ם לַחֹ֗שֶׁךְ וּֽלְכׇל־תַּ֭כְלִית ה֣וּא חוֹקֵ֑ר אֶ֖בֶן אֹ֣פֶל וְצַלְמָֽוֶת׃
translations.english:
He sets bounds for darkness;
To every limit man probes,
To rocks in deepest darkness.

translations.hebrew: פָּ֤רַץ נַ֨חַל ׀ מֵֽעִם־גָּ֗ר הַֽנִּשְׁכָּחִ֥ים מִנִּי־רָ֑גֶל דַּ֖לּוּ מֵאֱנ֣וֹשׁ נָֽעוּ׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.They open up a shaft far from where men live,
[In places] forgotten by wayfarers,
Destitute of men, far removed.-a

translations.hebrew: אֶ֗רֶץ מִמֶּ֥נָּה יֵֽצֵא־לָ֑חֶם וְ֝תַחְתֶּ֗יהָ נֶהְפַּ֥ךְ כְּמוֹ־אֵֽשׁ׃
translations.english:
Earth, out of which food grows,
Is changed below as if into fire.

translations.hebrew: מְקוֹם־סַפִּ֥יר אֲבָנֶ֑יהָ וְעַפְרֹ֖ת זָהָ֣ב לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Its rocks are a source of sapphires;
It contains gold dust too.

translations.hebrew: נָ֭תִיב לֹא־יְדָ֣עוֹ עָ֑יִט וְלֹ֥א שְׁ֝זָפַ֗תּוּ עֵ֣ין אַיָּֽה׃
translations.english:
No bird of prey knows the path to it;
The falcon’s eye has not gazed upon it.

translations.hebrew: לֹֽא־הִדְרִיכ֥וּהוּ בְנֵי־שָׁ֑חַץ לֹֽא־עָדָ֖ה עָלָ֣יו שָֽׁחַל׃
translations.english:
The proud beasts have not reached it;
The lion has not crossed it.

translations.hebrew: בַּ֭חַלָּמִישׁ שָׁלַ֣ח יָד֑וֹ הָפַ֖ךְ מִשֹּׁ֣רֶשׁ הָרִֽים׃
translations.english:
Man sets his hand against the flinty rock
And overturns mountains by the roots.

translations.hebrew: בַּ֭צּוּרוֹת יְאֹרִ֣ים בִּקֵּ֑עַ וְכׇל־יְ֝קָ֗ר רָאֲתָ֥ה עֵינֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He carves out channels through rock;
His eyes behold every precious thing.

translations.hebrew: מִ֭בְּכִי נְהָר֣וֹת חִבֵּ֑שׁ וְ֝תַעֲלֻמָ֗הּ יֹ֣צִא אֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
He dams up the sources of the streams
So that hidden things may be brought to light.

translations.hebrew: וְֽ֭הַחׇכְמָה מֵאַ֣יִן תִּמָּצֵ֑א וְאֵ֥י זֶ֝֗ה מְק֣וֹם בִּינָֽה׃
translations.english:
But where can wisdom be found;
Where is the source of understanding?

translations.hebrew: לֹא־יָדַ֣ע אֱנ֣וֹשׁ עֶרְכָּ֑הּ וְלֹ֥א תִ֝מָּצֵ֗א בְּאֶ֣רֶץ הַחַיִּֽים׃
translations.english:
No man can set a value on it;
It cannot be found in the land of the living.

translations.hebrew: תְּה֣וֹם אָ֭מַר לֹ֣א בִי־הִ֑יא וְיָ֥ם אָ֝מַ֗ר אֵ֣ין עִמָּדִֽי׃
translations.english:
The deep says, “It is not in me”;
The sea says, “I do not have it.”

translations.hebrew: לֹא־יֻתַּ֣ן סְג֣וֹר תַּחְתֶּ֑יהָ וְלֹ֥א יִ֝שָּׁקֵ֗ל כֶּ֣סֶף מְחִירָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
It cannot be bartered for gold;
Silver cannot be paid out as its price.

translations.hebrew: לֹא־תְ֭סֻלֶּה בְּכֶ֣תֶם אוֹפִ֑יר בְּשֹׁ֖הַם יָקָ֣ר וְסַפִּֽיר׃
translations.english:
The finest gold of Ophir cannot be weighed against it,
Nor precious onyx, nor sapphire.

translations.hebrew: לֹא־יַעַרְכֶ֣נָּה זָ֭הָב וּזְכוֹכִ֑ית וּתְמ֖וּרָתָ֣הּ כְּלִי־פָֽז׃
translations.english:
Gold or glass cannot match its value,
Nor vessels of fine gold be exchanged for it.

translations.hebrew: רָאמ֣וֹת וְ֭גָבִישׁ לֹ֣א יִזָּכֵ֑ר וּמֶ֥שֶׁךְ חׇ֝כְמָ֗ה מִפְּנִינִֽים׃
translations.english:
Coral and crystal cannot be mentioned with it;
A pouch of wisdom is better than rubies.

translations.hebrew: לֹֽא־יַ֭עַרְכֶנָּה פִּטְדַת־כּ֑וּשׁ בְּכֶ֥תֶם טָ֝ה֗וֹר לֹ֣א תְסֻלֶּֽה׃
translations.english:
Topaz from Nubia cannot match its value;
Pure gold cannot be weighed against it.

translations.hebrew: וְֽ֭הַחׇכְמָה מֵאַ֣יִן תָּב֑וֹא וְאֵ֥י זֶ֝֗ה מְק֣וֹם בִּינָֽה׃
translations.english:
But whence does wisdom come?
Where is the source of understanding?

translations.hebrew: וְֽ֭נֶעֶלְמָה מֵעֵינֵ֣י כׇל־חָ֑י וּמֵע֖וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם נִסְתָּֽרָה׃
translations.english:
It is hidden from the eyes of all living,
Concealed from the fowl of heaven.

translations.hebrew: אֲבַדּ֣וֹן וָ֭מָוֶת אָ֣מְר֑וּ בְּ֝אׇזְנֵ֗ינוּ שָׁמַ֥עְנוּ שִׁמְעָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
Abaddon and Death say,
“We have only a report of it.”

translations.hebrew: אֱ֭לֹהִים הֵבִ֣ין דַּרְכָּ֑הּ וְ֝ה֗וּא יָדַ֥ע אֶת־מְקוֹמָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
God understands the way to it;
He knows its source;

translations.hebrew: כִּי־ה֭וּא לִקְצוֹת־הָאָ֣רֶץ יַבִּ֑יט תַּ֖חַת כׇּל־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם יִרְאֶֽה׃
translations.english:
For He sees to the ends of the earth,
Observes all that is beneath the heavens.

translations.hebrew: לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת לָר֣וּחַ מִשְׁקָ֑ל וּ֝מַ֗יִם תִּכֵּ֥ן בְּמִדָּֽה׃
translations.english:
When He fixed the weight of the winds,
Set the measure of the waters;

translations.hebrew: בַּעֲשֹׂת֣וֹ לַמָּטָ֣ר חֹ֑ק וְ֝דֶ֗רֶךְ לַחֲזִ֥יז קֹלֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
When He made a rule for the rain
And a course for the thunderstorms,

translations.hebrew: אָ֣ז רָ֭אָהּ וַֽיְסַפְּרָ֑הּ הֱ֝כִינָ֗הּ וְגַם־חֲקָרָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
Then He saw it and gauged it;
He measured it and probed it.

translations.hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר ׀ לָאָדָ֗ם הֵ֤ן יִרְאַ֣ת אֲ֭דֹנָי הִ֣יא חׇכְמָ֑ה וְס֖וּר מֵרָ֣ע בִּינָֽה׃
translations.english:
He said to man,
“See! Fear of the Lord is wisdom;
To shun evil is understanding.”

translations.hebrew: וַיֹּ֣סֶף אִ֭יּוֹב שְׂאֵ֥ת מְשָׁל֗וֹ וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
translations.english: Job again took up his theme and said:

translations.hebrew: מִֽי־יִתְּנֵ֥נִי כְיַרְחֵי־קֶ֑דֶם כִּ֝ימֵ֗י אֱל֣וֹהַּ יִשְׁמְרֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
O that I were as in months gone by,
In the days when God watched over me,

translations.hebrew: בְּהִלּ֣וֹ נֵ֭רוֹ עֲלֵ֣י רֹאשִׁ֑י לְ֝אוֹר֗וֹ אֵ֣לֶךְ חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃
translations.english:
When His lamp shone over my head,
When I walked in the dark by its light,

translations.hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר הָ֭יִיתִי בִּימֵ֣י חׇרְפִּ֑י בְּס֥וֹד אֱ֝ל֗וֹהַּ עֲלֵ֣י אׇהֳלִֽי׃
translations.english:
When I was in my prime,
When God’s company graced my tent,

translations.hebrew: בְּע֣וֹד שַׁ֭דַּי עִמָּדִ֑י סְבִ֖יבוֹתַ֣י נְעָרָֽי׃
translations.english:
When Shaddai was still with me,
When my lads surrounded me,

translations.hebrew: בִּרְחֹ֣ץ הֲלִיכַ֣י בְּחֵמָ֑ה וְצ֥וּר יָצ֥וּק עִ֝מָּדִ֗י פַּלְגֵי־שָֽׁמֶן׃
translations.english:
When my feet were bathed in cream,
And rocks poured out streams of oil for me.

translations.hebrew: בְּצֵ֣אתִי שַׁ֣עַר עֲלֵי־קָ֑רֶת בָּ֝רְח֗וֹב אָכִ֥ין מוֹשָׁבִֽי׃
translations.english:
When I passed through the city gates
To take my seat in the square,

translations.hebrew: רָא֣וּנִי נְעָרִ֣ים וְנֶחְבָּ֑אוּ וִ֝ישִׁישִׁ֗ים קָ֣מוּ עָמָֽדוּ׃
translations.english:
Young men saw me and hid,
Elders rose and stood;

translations.hebrew: שָׂ֭רִים עָצְר֣וּ בְמִלִּ֑ים וְ֝כַ֗ף יָשִׂ֥ימוּ לְפִיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
Nobles held back their words;
They clapped their hands to their mouths.

translations.hebrew: קוֹל־נְגִידִ֥ים נֶחְבָּ֑אוּ וּ֝לְשׁוֹנָ֗ם לְחִכָּ֥ם דָּבֵֽקָה׃
translations.english:
The voices of princes were hushed;
Their tongues stuck to their palates.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י אֹ֣זֶן שָׁ֭מְעָה וַֽתְּאַשְּׁרֵ֑נִי וְעַ֥יִן רָ֝אֲתָ֗ה וַתְּעִידֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
The ear that heard me acclaimed me;
The eye that saw, commended me.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אֲ֭מַלֵּט עָנִ֣י מְשַׁוֵּ֑עַ וְ֝יָת֗וֹם וְֽלֹא־עֹזֵ֥ר לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
For I saved the poor man who cried out,
The orphan who had none to help him.

translations.hebrew: בִּרְכַּ֣ת אֹ֭בֵד עָלַ֣י תָּבֹ֑א וְלֵ֖ב אַלְמָנָ֣ה אַרְנִֽן׃
translations.english:
I received the blessing of the lost;
I gladdened the heart of the widow.

translations.hebrew: צֶ֣דֶק לָ֭בַשְׁתִּי וַיִּלְבָּשֵׁ֑נִי כִּֽמְעִ֥יל וְ֝צָנִ֗יף מִשְׁפָּטִֽי׃
translations.english:
I clothed myself in righteousness and it robed me;
Justice was my cloak and turban.

translations.hebrew: עֵינַ֣יִם הָ֭יִיתִי לַעִוֵּ֑ר וְרַגְלַ֖יִם לַפִּסֵּ֣חַ אָֽנִי׃
translations.english:
I was eyes to the blind
And feet to the lame.

translations.hebrew: אָ֣ב אָ֭נֹכִֽי לָאֶבְיוֹנִ֑ים וְרִ֖ב לֹא־יָדַ֣עְתִּי אֶחְקְרֵֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
I was a father to the needy,
And I looked into the case of the stranger.

translations.hebrew: וָ֭אֲשַׁבְּרָה מְתַלְּע֣וֹת עַוָּ֑ל וּ֝מִשִּׁנָּ֗יו אַשְׁלִ֥יךְ טָֽרֶף׃
translations.english:
I broke the jaws of the wrongdoer,
And I wrested prey from his teeth.

translations.hebrew: וָ֭אֹמַר עִם־קִנִּ֣י אֶגְוָ֑ע וְ֝כַח֗וֹל אַרְבֶּ֥ה יָמִֽים׃
translations.english:
I thought I would end my days with my family,aLit. “nest.”
And bOthers “multiply days like sand.”be as long-lived as the phoenix,-b

translations.hebrew: שׇׁרְשִׁ֣י פָת֣וּחַ אֱלֵי־מָ֑יִם וְ֝טַ֗ל יָלִ֥ין בִּקְצִירִֽי׃
translations.english:
My roots reaching water,
And dew lying on my branches;

translations.hebrew: כְּ֭בוֹדִי חָדָ֣שׁ עִמָּדִ֑י וְ֝קַשְׁתִּ֗י בְּיָדִ֥י תַחֲלִֽיף׃
translations.english:
My vigor refreshed,
My bow ever new in my hand.

translations.hebrew: לִֽי־שָׁמְע֥וּ וְיִחֵ֑לּוּ וְ֝יִדְּמ֗וּ לְמ֣וֹ עֲצָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
Men would listen to me expectantly,
And wait for my counsel.

translations.hebrew: אַחֲרֵ֣י דְ֭בָרִי לֹ֣א יִשְׁנ֑וּ וְ֝עָלֵ֗ימוֹ תִּטֹּ֥ף מִלָּתִֽי׃
translations.english:
After I spoke they had nothing to say;
My words were as drops [of dew] upon them.

translations.hebrew: וְיִחֲל֣וּ כַמָּטָ֣ר לִ֑י וּ֝פִיהֶ֗ם פָּעֲר֥וּ לְמַלְקֽוֹשׁ׃
translations.english:
They waited for me as for rain,
For the late rain, their mouths open wide.

translations.hebrew: אֶשְׂחַ֣ק אֲ֭לֵהֶם לֹ֣א יַאֲמִ֑ינוּ וְא֥וֹר פָּ֝נַ֗י לֹ֣א יַפִּילֽוּן׃
translations.english:
When I smiled at them, they would not believe it;
They never expectedcTaking yappilun as from pll; cf. Gen. 48.11. a sign of my favor.

translations.hebrew: אֶ֥בְחַ֣ר דַּרְכָּם֮ וְאֵשֵׁ֢ב רֹ֥֫אשׁ וְ֭אֶשְׁכּוֹן כְּמֶ֣לֶךְ בַּגְּד֑וּד כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר אֲבֵלִ֣ים יְנַחֵֽם׃
translations.english:
I decided their course and presided over them;
I lived like a king among his troops,
Like one who consoles mourners.

translations.hebrew: וְעַתָּ֤ה ׀ שָׂ֥חֲק֣וּ עָלַי֮ צְעִירִ֥ים מִמֶּ֗נִּי לְיָ֫מִ֥ים אֲשֶׁר־מָאַ֥סְתִּי אֲבוֹתָ֑ם לָ֝שִׁ֗ית עִם־כַּלְבֵ֥י צֹאנִֽי׃
translations.english:
But now those younger than I deride me,
[Men] whose fathers I would have disdained to put among my sheep dogs.

translations.hebrew: גַּם־כֹּ֣חַ יְ֭דֵיהֶם לָ֣מָּה לִּ֑י עָ֝לֵ֗ימוֹ אָ֣בַד כָּֽלַח׃
translations.english:
Of what use to me is the strength of their hands?
All their vigoraMeaning of Heb. uncertain. is gone.

translations.hebrew: בְּחֶ֥סֶר וּבְכָפָ֗ן גַּ֫לְמ֥וּד הַעֹרְקִ֥ים צִיָּ֑ה אֶ֝֗מֶשׁ שׁוֹאָ֥ה וּמְשֹׁאָֽה׃
translations.english:
Wasted from want and starvation,
They flee to a parched land,
To the gloom of desolate wasteland.

translations.hebrew: הַקֹּטְפִ֣ים מַלּ֣וּחַ עֲלֵי־שִׂ֑יחַ וְשֹׁ֖רֶשׁ רְתָמִ֣ים לַחְמָֽם׃
translations.english:
They pluck saltwort and wormwood;
The roots of broom are their food.

translations.hebrew: מִן־גֵּ֥ו יְגֹרָ֑שׁוּ יָרִ֥יעוּ עָ֝לֵ֗ימוֹ כַּגַּנָּֽב׃
translations.english:
Driven out aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.from society,-a
They are cried at like a thief.

translations.hebrew: בַּעֲר֣וּץ נְחָלִ֣ים לִשְׁכֹּ֑ן חֹרֵ֖י עָפָ֣ר וְכֵפִֽים׃
translations.english:
They live in the gullies of wadis,
In holes in the ground, and in rocks,

translations.hebrew: בֵּין־שִׂיחִ֥ים יִנְהָ֑קוּ תַּ֖חַת חָר֣וּל יְסֻפָּֽחוּ׃
translations.english:
Braying among the bushes,
Huddling among the nettles,

translations.hebrew: בְּֽנֵי־נָ֭בָל גַּם־בְּנֵ֣י בְלִי־שֵׁ֑ם נִ֝כְּא֗וּ מִן־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
Scoundrels, nobodies,
Stricken from the earth.

translations.hebrew: וְ֭עַתָּה נְגִינָתָ֣ם הָיִ֑יתִי וָאֱהִ֖י לָהֶ֣ם לְמִלָּֽה׃
translations.english:
Now I am the butt of their gibes;
I have become a byword to them.

translations.hebrew: תִּ֭עֲבוּנִי רָ֣חֲקוּ מֶ֑נִּי וּ֝מִפָּנַ֗י לֹא־חָ֥שְׂכוּ רֹֽק׃
translations.english:
They abhor me; they keep their distance from me;
They do not withhold spittle from my face.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־[יִתְרִ֣י] (יתרו) פִ֭תַּח וַיְעַנֵּ֑נִי וְ֝רֶ֗סֶן מִפָּנַ֥י שִׁלֵּֽחוּ׃
translations.english:
Because GodbLit. “He.” has disarmedcLit. “loosened my [bow] string.” and humbled me,
They have thrown off restraint in my presence.

translations.hebrew: עַל־יָמִין֮ פִּרְחַ֢ח יָ֫ק֥וּמוּ רַגְלַ֥י שִׁלֵּ֑חוּ וַיָּסֹ֥לּוּ עָ֝לַ֗י אׇרְח֥וֹת אֵידָֽם׃
translations.english:
Mere striplings assail me at my right hand:
They put me to flight;
They build their roads for my ruin.

translations.hebrew: נָֽתְס֗וּ נְֽתִיבָ֫תִ֥י לְהַוָּתִ֥י יֹעִ֑ילוּ לֹ֖א עֹזֵ֣ר לָֽמוֹ׃
translations.english:
They tear up my path;
They promote my fall,
Although it does them no good.

translations.hebrew: כְּפֶ֣רֶץ רָחָ֣ב יֶאֱתָ֑יוּ תַּ֥חַת שֹׁ֝אָ֗ה הִתְגַּלְגָּֽלוּ׃
translations.english:
They come as through a wide breach;
They roll in aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.like raging billows.-a

translations.hebrew: הׇהְפַּ֥ךְ עָלַ֗י בַּלָּ֫ה֥וֹת תִּרְדֹּ֣ף כָּ֭רוּחַ נְדִבָתִ֑י וּ֝כְעָ֗ב עָבְרָ֥ה יְשֻׁעָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
Terror tumbles upon me;
It sweeps away my honor like the wind;
My dignitydHeb. yeshu‘athi taken as related to shoa‘, “noble.” vanishes like a cloud.

translations.hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה עָ֭לַי תִּשְׁתַּפֵּ֣ךְ נַפְשִׁ֑י יֹ֖אחֲז֣וּנִי יְמֵי־עֹֽנִי׃
translations.english:
So now my life runs out;
Days of misery have taken hold of me.

translations.hebrew: לַ֗יְלָה עֲ֭צָמַי נִקַּ֣ר מֵעָלָ֑י וְ֝עֹרְקַ֗י לֹ֣א יִשְׁכָּבֽוּן׃
translations.english:
By night my bones feel gnawed;
My sinews never rest.

translations.hebrew: בְּרׇב־כֹּ֭חַ יִתְחַפֵּ֣שׂ לְבוּשִׁ֑י כְּפִ֖י כֻתׇּנְתִּ֣י יַאַזְרֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.With great effort I change clothing;
The neck of my tunic fits my waist.-a

translations.hebrew: הֹרָ֥נִי לַחֹ֑מֶר וָ֝אֶתְמַשֵּׁ֗ל כֶּעָפָ֥ר וָאֵֽפֶר׃
translations.english:
He regarded me as clay,
I have become like dust and ashes.

translations.hebrew: אֲשַׁוַּ֣ע אֵ֭לֶיךָ וְלֹ֣א תַעֲנֵ֑נִי עָ֝מַ֗דְתִּי וַתִּתְבֹּ֥נֶן בִּֽי׃
translations.english:
I cry out to You, but You do not answer me;
I wait, but You do [not] consider me.

translations.hebrew: תֵּהָפֵ֣ךְ לְאַכְזָ֣ר לִ֑י בְּעֹ֖צֶם יָדְךָ֣ תִשְׂטְמֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
You have become cruel to me;
With Your powerful hand You harass me.

translations.hebrew: תִּשָּׂאֵ֣נִי אֶל־ר֭וּחַ תַּרְכִּיבֵ֑נִי וּ֝תְמֹגְגֵ֗נִי (תשוה) [תּוּשִׁיָּֽה]׃
translations.english:
You lift me up and mount me on the wind;
You make my courage melt.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־יָ֭דַעְתִּי מָ֣וֶת תְּשִׁיבֵ֑נִי וּבֵ֖ית מוֹעֵ֣ד לְכׇל־חָֽי׃
translations.english:
I know You will bring me to death,
The house assigned for all the living.

translations.hebrew: אַ֣ךְ לֹֽא־בְ֭עִי יִשְׁלַח־יָ֑ד אִם־בְּ֝פִיד֗וֹ לָהֶ֥ן שֽׁוּעַ׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Surely He would not strike at a ruin
If, in calamity, one cried out to Him.-a

translations.hebrew: אִם־לֹ֣א בָ֭כִיתִי לִקְשֵׁה־י֑וֹם עָֽגְמָ֥ה נַ֝פְשִׁ֗י לָאֶבְיֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
Did I not weep for the unfortunate?
Did I not grieve for the needy?

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י ט֣וֹב קִ֭וִּיתִי וַיָּ֣בֹא רָ֑ע וַאֲיַחֲלָ֥ה לְ֝א֗וֹר וַיָּ֥בֹא אֹֽפֶל׃
translations.english:
I looked forward to good fortune, but evil came;
I hoped for light, but darkness came.

translations.hebrew: מֵעַ֖י רֻתְּח֥וּ וְלֹא־דָ֗מּוּ קִדְּמֻ֥נִי יְמֵי־עֹֽנִי׃
translations.english:
My bowels are in turmoil without respite;
Days of misery confront me.

translations.hebrew: קֹדֵ֣ר הִ֭לַּכְתִּי בְּלֹ֣א חַמָּ֑ה קַ֖מְתִּי בַקָּהָ֣ל אֲשַׁוֵּֽעַ׃
translations.english:
I walk about in sunless gloom;
I rise in the assembly and cry out.

translations.hebrew: אָ֭ח הָיִ֣יתִי לְתַנִּ֑ים וְ֝רֵ֗עַ לִבְנ֥וֹת יַעֲנָֽה׃
translations.english:
I have become a brother to jackals,
A companion to ostriches.

translations.hebrew: ע֭וֹרִי שָׁחַ֣ר מֵעָלָ֑י וְעַצְמִי־חָ֝֗רָה מִנִּי־חֹֽרֶב׃
translations.english:
My skin, blackened, is peeling off me;
My bones are charred by the heat.

translations.hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י לְ֭אֵבֶל כִּנֹּרִ֑י וְ֝עֻגָבִ֗י לְק֣וֹל בֹּכִֽים׃
translations.english:
So my lyre is given over to mourning,
My pipe, to accompany weepers.

translations.hebrew: בְּ֭רִית כָּרַ֣תִּי לְעֵינָ֑י וּמָ֥ה אֶ֝תְבּוֹנֵ֗ן עַל־בְּתוּלָֽה׃
translations.english:
I have covenanted with my eyes
Not to gaze on a maiden.

translations.hebrew: וּמֶ֤ה חֵ֣לֶק אֱל֣וֹהַּ מִמָּ֑עַל וְֽנַחֲלַ֥ת שַׁ֝דַּ֗י מִמְּרֹמִֽים׃
translations.english:
What fate is decreed by God above?
What lot, by Shaddai in the heights?

translations.hebrew: הֲלֹא־אֵ֥יד לְעַוָּ֑ל וְ֝נֵ֗כֶר לְפֹ֣עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
translations.english:
Calamity is surely for the iniquitous;
Misfortune, for the worker of mischief.

translations.hebrew: הֲלֹא־ה֭וּא יִרְאֶ֣ה דְרָכָ֑י וְֽכׇל־צְעָדַ֥י יִסְפּֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
Surely He observes my ways,
Takes account of my every step.

translations.hebrew: אִם־הָלַ֥כְתִּי עִם־שָׁ֑וְא וַתַּ֖חַשׁ עַל־מִרְמָ֣ה רַגְלִֽי׃
translations.english:
Have I walked with worthless men,
Or my feet hurried to deceit?

translations.hebrew: יִשְׁקְלֵ֥נִי בְמֹֽאזְנֵי־צֶ֑דֶק וְיֵדַ֥ע אֱ֝ל֗וֹהַּ תֻּמָּתִֽי׃
translations.english:
Let Him weigh me on the scale of righteousness;
Let God ascertain my integrity.

translations.hebrew: אִ֥ם־תִּטֶּ֣ה אַשֻּׁרִי֮ מִנִּ֢י הַ֫דָּ֥רֶךְ וְאַחַ֣ר עֵ֭ינַי הָלַ֣ךְ לִבִּ֑י וּ֝בְכַפַּ֗י דָּ֣בַק מֽאוּם׃
translations.english:
If my feet have strayed from their course,
My heart followed after my eyes,
And a stain sullied my hands,

translations.hebrew: אֶ֭זְרְעָה וְאַחֵ֣ר יֹאכֵ֑ל וְֽצֶאֱצָאַ֥י יְשֹׁרָֽשׁוּ׃
translations.english:
May I sow, but another reap,
May the growth of my field be uprooted!

translations.hebrew: אִם־נִפְתָּ֣ה לִ֭בִּי עַל־אִשָּׁ֑ה וְעַל־פֶּ֖תַח רֵעִ֣י אָרָֽבְתִּי׃
translations.english:
If my heart was ravished by the wife of my neighbor,
And I lay in wait at his door,

translations.hebrew: תִּטְחַ֣ן לְאַחֵ֣ר אִשְׁתִּ֑י וְ֝עָלֶ֗יהָ יִכְרְע֥וּן אֲחֵרִֽין׃
translations.english:
May my wife grind for another,
May others kneel over her!

translations.hebrew: כִּי־[הִ֥יא] (הוא) זִמָּ֑ה (והיא) [וְ֝ה֗וּא] עָוֺ֥ן פְּלִילִֽים׃
translations.english:
For that would have been debauchery,
A criminal offense,

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י אֵ֣שׁ הִ֭יא עַד־אֲבַדּ֣וֹן תֹּאכֵ֑ל וּֽבְכׇל־תְּב֖וּאָתִ֣י תְשָׁרֵֽשׁ׃
translations.english:
A fire burning down to Abaddon,
Consuming the roots of all my increase.

translations.hebrew: אִם־אֶמְאַ֗ס מִשְׁפַּ֣ט עַ֭בְדִּי וַאֲמָתִ֑י בְּ֝רִבָ֗ם עִמָּדִֽי׃
translations.english:
Did I ever brush aside the case of my servants, man or maid,
When they made a complaint against me?

translations.hebrew: וּמָ֣ה אֶ֭עֱשֶׂה כִּֽי־יָק֣וּם אֵ֑ל וְכִי־יִ֝פְקֹ֗ד מָ֣ה אֲשִׁיבֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
What then should I do when God arises;
When He calls me to account, what should I answer Him?

translations.hebrew: הֲֽלֹא־בַ֭בֶּטֶן עֹשֵׂ֣נִי עָשָׂ֑הוּ וַ֝יְכֻנֶ֗נּוּ בָּרֶ֥חֶם אֶחָֽד׃
translations.english:
Did not He who made me in my mother’s belly make him?
Did not One form us both in the womb?

translations.hebrew: אִם־אֶ֭מְנַע מֵחֵ֣פֶץ דַּלִּ֑ים וְעֵינֵ֖י אַלְמָנָ֣ה אֲכַלֶּֽה׃
translations.english:
Did I deny the poor their needs,
Or let aaLit. “the eyes of a.” widow pine away,

translations.hebrew: וְאֹכַ֣ל פִּתִּ֣י לְבַדִּ֑י וְלֹֽא־אָכַ֖ל יָת֣וֹם מִמֶּֽנָּה׃
translations.english:
By eating my food alone,
The fatherless not eating of it also?

translations.hebrew: כִּ֣י מִ֭נְּעוּרַי גְּדֵלַ֣נִי כְאָ֑ב וּמִבֶּ֖טֶן אִמִּ֣י אַנְחֶֽנָּה׃
translations.english:
Why, from my youth he grew up with me as though I were his father;
Since I left my mother’s womb I was herbViz., the widow’s. guide.

translations.hebrew: אִם־אֶרְאֶ֣ה א֭וֹבֵד מִבְּלִ֣י לְב֑וּשׁ וְאֵ֥ין כְּ֝ס֗וּת לָאֶבְיֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
I never saw an unclad wretch,
A needy man without clothing,

translations.hebrew: אִם־לֹ֣א בֵרְכ֣וּנִי חֲלָצָ֑ו וּמִגֵּ֥ז כְּ֝בָשַׂ֗י יִתְחַמָּֽם׃
translations.english:
Whose loins did not bless me
As he warmed himself with the shearings of my sheep.

translations.hebrew: אִם־הֲנִיפ֣וֹתִי עַל־יָת֣וֹם יָדִ֑י כִּֽי־אֶרְאֶ֥ה בַ֝שַּׁ֗עַר עֶזְרָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
If I raised my hand against the fatherless,
Looking to my supporters in the gate,

translations.hebrew: כְּ֭תֵפִי מִשִּׁכְמָ֣הֿ תִפּ֑וֹל וְ֝אֶזְרֹעִ֗י מִקָּנָ֥הֿ תִשָּׁבֵֽר׃
translations.english:
May my arm drop off my shoulder;
My forearm break off cLit. “from its shaft,” i.e., the humerus.at the elbow.-c

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י פַ֣חַד אֵ֭לַי אֵ֣יד אֵ֑ל וּ֝מִשְּׂאֵת֗וֹ לֹ֣א אוּכָֽל׃
translations.english:
For I am in dread of God-sent calamity;
I cannot bear His threat.

translations.hebrew: אִם־שַׂ֣מְתִּי זָהָ֣ב כִּסְלִ֑י וְ֝לַכֶּ֗תֶם אָמַ֥רְתִּי מִבְטַחִֽי׃
translations.english:
Did I put my reliance on gold,
Or regard fine gold as my bulwark?

translations.hebrew: אִם־אֶ֭שְׂמַח כִּֽי־רַ֣ב חֵילִ֑י וְכִֽי־כַ֝בִּ֗יר מָצְאָ֥ה יָדִֽי׃
translations.english:
Did I rejoice in my great wealth,
In having attained plenty?

translations.hebrew: אִם־אֶרְאֶ֣ה א֭וֹר כִּ֣י יָהֵ֑ל וְ֝יָרֵ֗חַ יָקָ֥ר הֹלֵֽךְ׃
translations.english:
If ever I saw the light shining,
The moon on its course in full glory,

translations.hebrew: וַיִּ֣פְתְּ בַּסֵּ֣תֶר לִבִּ֑י וַתִּשַּׁ֖ק יָדִ֣י לְפִֽי׃
translations.english:
And I secretly succumbed,
And my hand touched my mouth in a kiss,

translations.hebrew: גַּם־ה֭וּא עָוֺ֣ן פְּלִילִ֑י כִּֽי־כִחַ֖שְׁתִּי לָאֵ֣ל מִמָּֽעַל׃
translations.english:
That, too, would have been a criminal offense,
For I would have denied God above.

translations.hebrew: אִם־אֶ֭שְׂמַח בְּפִ֣יד מְשַׂנְאִ֑י וְ֝הִתְעֹרַ֗רְתִּי כִּֽי־מְצָ֥אוֹ רָֽע׃
translations.english:
Did I rejoice over my enemy’s misfortune?
Did I thrill because evil befell him?

translations.hebrew: וְלֹא־נָתַ֣תִּי לַחֲטֹ֣א חִכִּ֑י לִשְׁאֹ֖ל בְּאָלָ֣ה נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
translations.english:
I never let my mouthdLit. “palate.” sin
By wishing his death in a curse.

translations.hebrew: אִם־לֹ֣א אָ֭מְרוּ מְתֵ֣י אׇהֳלִ֑י מִי־יִתֵּ֥ן מִ֝בְּשָׂר֗וֹ לֹ֣א נִשְׂבָּֽע׃
translations.english:
(Indeed, the men of my clan said,
“We would consume his flesh insatiably!”)

translations.hebrew: בַּ֭חוּץ לֹא־יָלִ֣ין גֵּ֑ר דְּ֝לָתַ֗י לָאֹ֥רַח אֶפְתָּֽח׃
translations.english:
No sojourner spent the night in the open;
I opened my doors to the road.

translations.hebrew: אִם־כִּסִּ֣יתִי כְאָדָ֣ם פְּשָׁעָ֑י לִטְמ֖וֹן בְּחֻבִּ֣י עֲוֺנִֽי׃
translations.english:
Did I hide my transgressions like Adam,
Bury my wrongdoing in my bosom,

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י אֶעֱר֨וֹץ ׀ הָ֘מ֤וֹן רַבָּ֗ה וּבוּז־מִשְׁפָּח֥וֹת יְחִתֵּ֑נִי וָ֝אֶדֹּ֗ם לֹא־אֵ֥צֵא פָֽתַח׃
translations.english:
That I should [now] fear the great multitude,
And am shattered by the contempt of families,
So that I keep silent and do not step outdoors?

translations.hebrew: מִ֤י יִתֶּן־לִ֨י ׀ שֹׁ֘מֵ֤עַֽ לִ֗י הֶן־תָּ֭וִי שַׁדַּ֣י יַעֲנֵ֑נִי וְסֵ֥פֶר כָּ֝תַ֗ב אִ֣ישׁ רִיבִֽי׃
translations.english:
O that I had someone to give me a hearing;
O that Shaddai would reply to my writ,
Or my accuser draw up a true bill!

translations.hebrew: אִם־לֹ֣א עַל־שִׁ֭כְמִי אֶשָּׂאֶ֑נּוּ אֶעֶנְדֶ֖נּוּ עֲטָר֣וֹת לִֽי׃
translations.english:
I would carry it on my shoulder;
Tie it around me for a wreath.

translations.hebrew: מִסְפַּ֣ר צְ֭עָדַי אַגִּידֶ֑נּוּ כְּמוֹ־נָ֝גִ֗יד אֲקָֽרְבֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
I would give him an account of my steps,
Offer it as to a commander.

translations.hebrew: אִם־עָ֭לַי אַדְמָתִ֣י תִזְעָ֑ק וְ֝יַ֗חַד תְּלָמֶ֥יהָ יִבְכָּיֽוּן׃
translations.english:
If my land cries out against me,
Its furrows weep together;

translations.hebrew: אִם־כֹּ֭חָהּ אָכַ֣לְתִּי בְלִי־כָ֑סֶף וְנֶ֖פֶשׁ בְּעָלֶ֣יהָ הִפָּֽחְתִּי׃
translations.english:
If I have eaten its produce without payment,
And made its [rightful] owners despair,

translations.hebrew: תַּ֤חַת חִטָּ֨ה ׀ יֵ֥צֵא ח֗וֹחַ וְתַֽחַת־שְׂעֹרָ֥ה בׇאְשָׁ֑ה תַּ֝֗מּוּ דִּבְרֵ֥י אִיּֽוֹב׃
translations.english:
May nettles grow there instead of wheat;
Instead of barley, stinkweed!

The words of Job are at an end.

translations.hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁבְּת֡וּ שְׁלֹ֤שֶׁת הָאֲנָשִׁ֣ים הָ֭אֵלֶּה מֵעֲנ֣וֹת אֶת־אִיּ֑וֹב כִּ֤י ה֖וּא צַדִּ֣יק בְּעֵינָֽיו׃
translations.english: These three men ceased replying to Job, for he considered himself right.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּ֤חַר אַ֨ף ׀ אֱלִיה֣וּא בֶן־בַּרַכְאֵ֣ל הַבּוּזִי֮ מִמִּשְׁפַּ֢חַ֫ת רָ֥ם בְּ֭אִיּוֹב חָרָ֣ה אַפּ֑וֹ עַֽל־צַדְּק֥וֹ נַ֝פְשׁ֗וֹ מֵאֱלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english: Then Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite, of the family of Ram, was angry—angry at Job because he thought himself right against God.

translations.hebrew: וּבִשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת רֵעָיו֮ חָרָ֢ה אַ֫פּ֥וֹ עַ֤ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־מָצְא֣וּ מַעֲנֶ֑ה וַ֝יַּרְשִׁ֗יעוּ אֶת־אִיּֽוֹב׃
translations.english: He was angry as well at his three friends, because they found no reply, but merely condemned Job.

translations.hebrew: וֶאֱלִיה֗וּ חִכָּ֣ה אֶת־אִ֭יּוֹב בִּדְבָרִ֑ים כִּ֤י זְֽקֵנִים־הֵ֖מָּה מִמֶּ֣נּוּ לְיָמִֽים׃
translations.english: Elihu waited out Job’s speech, for they were all older than he.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּ֤רְא אֱלִיה֗וּא כִּ֘י־אֵ֤ין מַעֲנֶ֗ה בְּ֭פִי שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת הָאֲנָשִׁ֗ים וַיִּ֥חַר אַפּֽוֹ׃
translations.english: But when Elihu saw that the three men had nothing to reply, he was angry.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַן ׀ אֱלִיה֖וּא בֶן־בַּרַכְאֵ֥ל הַבּוּזִ֗י וַיֹּ֫אמַ֥ר צָ֘עִ֤יר אֲנִ֣י לְ֭יָמִים וְאַתֶּ֣ם יְשִׁישִׁ֑ים עַל־כֵּ֖ן זָחַ֥לְתִּי וָאִירָ֓א ׀ מֵחַוֺּ֖ת דֵּעִ֣י אֶתְכֶֽם׃
translations.english:
Then Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite said in reply:

I have but few years, while you are old;
Therefore I was too awestruck and fearful
To hold forth among you.

translations.hebrew: אָ֭מַרְתִּי יָמִ֣ים יְדַבֵּ֑רוּ וְרֹ֥ב שָׁ֝נִ֗ים יֹדִ֥יעוּ חׇכְמָֽה׃
translations.english:
I thought, “Let age speak;
Let advanced years declare wise things.”

translations.hebrew: אָ֭כֵן רוּחַ־הִ֣יא בֶאֱנ֑וֹשׁ וְנִשְׁמַ֖ת שַׁדַּ֣י תְּבִינֵֽם׃
translations.english:
But truly it is the spirit in men,
The breath of Shaddai, that gives them understanding.

translations.hebrew: לֹא־רַבִּ֥ים יֶחְכָּ֑מוּ וּ֝זְקֵנִ֗ים יָבִ֥ינוּ מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
translations.english:
It is not the aged who are wise,
The elders, who understand how to judge.

translations.hebrew: לָכֵ֣ן אָ֭מַרְתִּי שִׁמְעָה־לִּ֑י אֲחַוֶּ֖ה דֵעִ֣י אַף־אָֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Therefore I say, “Listen to me;
I too would hold forth.”

translations.hebrew: הֵ֤ן הוֹחַ֨לְתִּי ׀ לְֽדִבְרֵיכֶ֗ם אָ֭זִין עַד־תְּב֥וּנֹֽתֵיכֶ֑ם עַֽד־תַּחְקְר֥וּן מִלִּֽין׃
translations.english:
Here I have waited out your speeches,
I have given ear to your insights,
While you probed the issues;

translations.hebrew: וְעָ֥דֵיכֶ֗ם אֶתְבּ֫וֹנָ֥ן וְהִנֵּ֤ה אֵ֣ין לְאִיּ֣וֹב מוֹכִ֑יחַ עוֹנֶ֖ה אֲמָרָ֣יו מִכֶּֽם׃
translations.english:
But as I attended to you,
I saw that none of you could argue with Job,
Or offer replies to his statements.

translations.hebrew: פֶּן־תֹּ֣֭אמְרוּ מָצָ֣אנוּ חׇכְמָ֑ה אֵ֖ל יִדְּפֶ֣נּוּ לֹא־אִֽישׁ׃
translations.english:
I fear you will say, “We have found the wise course;
God will defeat him, not man.”

translations.hebrew: וְלֹא־עָרַ֣ךְ אֵלַ֣י מִלִּ֑ין וּ֝בְאִמְרֵיכֶ֗ם לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
He did not set out his case against me,
Nor shall I use your reasons to reply to him.

translations.hebrew: חַ֭תּוּ לֹא־עָ֣נוּ ע֑וֹד הֶעְתִּ֖יקוּ מֵהֶ֣ם מִלִּֽים׃
translations.english:
They have been broken and can no longer reply;
Words fail them.

translations.hebrew: וְ֭הוֹחַלְתִּי כִּי־לֹ֣א יְדַבֵּ֑רוּ כִּ֥י עָ֝מְד֗וּ לֹא־עָ֥נוּ עֽוֹד׃
translations.english:
I have waited till they stopped speaking,
Till they ended and no longer replied.

translations.hebrew: אַעֲנֶ֣ה אַף־אֲנִ֣י חֶלְקִ֑י אֲחַוֶּ֖ה דֵעִ֣י אַף־אָֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Now I also would have my say;
I too would like to hold forth,

translations.hebrew: כִּ֭י מָלֵ֣תִי מִלִּ֑ים הֱ֝צִיקַ֗תְנִי ר֣וּחַ בִּטְנִֽי׃
translations.english:
For I am full of words;
The wind in my belly presses me.

translations.hebrew: הִנֵּֽה־בִטְנִ֗י כְּיַ֥יִן לֹֽא־יִפָּתֵ֑חַ כְּאֹב֥וֹת חֲ֝דָשִׁ֗ים יִבָּקֵֽעַ׃
translations.english:
My belly is like wine not yet opened,
Like jugs of new wine ready to burst.

translations.hebrew: אֲדַבְּרָ֥ה וְיִֽרְוַֽח־לִ֑י אֶפְתַּ֖ח שְׂפָתַ֣י וְאֶעֱנֶֽה׃
translations.english:
Let me speak, then, and get relief;
Let me open my lips and reply.

translations.hebrew: אַל־נָ֭א אֶשָּׂ֣א פְנֵי־אִ֑ישׁ וְאֶל־אָ֝דָ֗ם לֹ֣א אֲכַנֶּֽה׃
translations.english:
I would not show regard for any man,
Or temper my speech for anyone’s sake;

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א יָדַ֣עְתִּי אֲכַנֶּ֑ה כִּ֝מְעַ֗ט יִשָּׂאֵ֥נִי עֹשֵֽׂנִי׃
translations.english:
For I do not know how to temper my speech—
My Maker would soon carry me off!

translations.hebrew: וְֽאוּלָ֗ם שְׁמַֽע־נָ֣א אִיּ֣וֹב מִלָּ֑י וְֽכׇל־דְּבָרַ֥י הַאֲזִֽינָה׃
translations.english:
But now, Job, listen to my words,
Give ear to all that I say.

translations.hebrew: הִנֵּה־נָ֭א פָּתַ֣חְתִּי פִ֑י דִּבְּרָ֖ה לְשׁוֹנִ֣י בְחִכִּֽי׃
translations.english:
Now I open my lips;
My tongue forms words in my mouth.

translations.hebrew: יֹשֶׁר־לִבִּ֥י אֲמָרָ֑י וְדַ֥עַת שְׂ֝פָתַ֗י בָּר֥וּר מִלֵּֽלוּ׃
translations.english:
My words bespeak the uprightness of my heart;
My lips utter insight honestly.

translations.hebrew: רֽוּחַ־אֵ֥ל עָשָׂ֑תְנִי וְנִשְׁמַ֖ת שַׁדַּ֣י תְּחַיֵּֽנִי׃
translations.english:
The spirit of God formed me;
The breath of Shaddai sustains me.

translations.hebrew: אִם־תּוּכַ֥ל הֲשִׁיבֵ֑נִי עֶרְכָ֥הֿ לְ֝פָנַ֗י הִתְיַצָּֽבָה׃
translations.english:
If you can, answer me;
Argue against me, take your stand.

translations.hebrew: הֵן־אֲנִ֣י כְפִ֣יךָ לָאֵ֑ל מֵ֝חֹ֗מֶר קֹרַ֥צְתִּי גַם־אָֽנִי׃
translations.english:
You and I are the same before God;
I too was nipped from clay.

translations.hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה אֵ֭מָתִי לֹ֣א תְבַעֲתֶ֑ךָּ וְ֝אַכְפִּ֗י עָלֶ֥יךָ לֹֽא־יִכְבָּֽד׃
translations.english:
You are not overwhelmed by fear of me;
My pressure does not weigh heavily on you.

translations.hebrew: אַ֭ךְ אָמַ֣רְתָּ בְאׇזְנָ֑י וְק֖וֹל מִלִּ֣ין אֶשְׁמָֽע׃
translations.english:
Indeed, you have stated in my hearing,
I heard the words spoken,

translations.hebrew: זַ֥ךְ אֲנִ֗י בְּֽלִ֫י־פָ֥שַׁע חַ֥ף אָנֹכִ֑י וְלֹ֖א עָוֺ֣ן לִֽי׃
translations.english:
“I am guiltless, free from transgression;
I am innocent, without iniquity.

translations.hebrew: הֵ֣ן תְּ֭נוּאוֹת עָלַ֣י יִמְצָ֑א יַחְשְׁבֵ֖נִי לְאוֹיֵ֣ב לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
But He finds reasons to oppose me,
Considers me His enemy.

translations.hebrew: יָשֵׂ֣ם בַּסַּ֣ד רַגְלָ֑י יִ֝שְׁמֹ֗ר כׇּל־אׇרְחֹתָֽי׃
translations.english:
He puts my feet in stocks,
Watches all my ways.”

translations.hebrew: הֶן־זֹ֣את לֹא־צָדַ֣קְתָּ אֶעֱנֶ֑ךָּ כִּי־יִרְבֶּ֥ה אֱ֝ל֗וֹהַּ מֵאֱנֽוֹשׁ׃
translations.english:
In this you are not right;
I will answer you: God is greater than any man.

translations.hebrew: מַ֭דּוּעַ אֵלָ֣יו רִיב֑וֹתָ כִּ֥י כׇל־דְּ֝בָרָ֗יו לֹ֣א יַעֲנֶֽה׃
translations.english:
Why do you complain against Him
That He does not reply to any of man’s charges?

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־בְאַחַ֥ת יְדַבֶּר־אֵ֑ל וּ֝בִשְׁתַּ֗יִם לֹ֣א יְשׁוּרֶֽנָּה׃
translations.english:
For God speaks aLit. “once…twice.”time and again-a—
Though man does not perceive it—

translations.hebrew: בַּחֲל֤וֹם ׀ חֶזְי֬וֹן לַ֗יְלָה בִּנְפֹ֣ל תַּ֭רְדֵּמָה עַל־אֲנָשִׁ֑ים בִּ֝תְנוּמ֗וֹת עֲלֵ֣י מִשְׁכָּֽב׃
translations.english:
In a dream, a night vision,
When deep sleep falls on men,
While they slumber on their beds.

translations.hebrew: אָ֣ז יִ֭גְלֶה אֹ֣זֶן אֲנָשִׁ֑ים וּבְמֹ֖סָרָ֣ם יַחְתֹּֽם׃
translations.english:
Then He opens men’s understanding,
And by disciplining them leaves His signature

translations.hebrew: לְ֭הָסִיר אָדָ֣ם מַעֲשֶׂ֑ה וְגֵוָ֖ה מִגֶּ֣בֶר יְכַסֶּֽה׃
translations.english:
To turn man away from an action,
To suppress pride in man.

translations.hebrew: יַחְשֹׂ֣ךְ נַ֭פְשׁוֹ מִנִּי־שָׁ֑חַת וְ֝חַיָּת֗וֹ מֵעֲבֹ֥ר בַּשָּֽׁלַח׃
translations.english:
He spares him from the Pit,
His person, from perishing by the sword.

translations.hebrew: וְהוּכַ֣ח בְּ֭מַכְאוֹב עַל־מִשְׁכָּב֑וֹ (וריב) [וְר֖וֹב] עֲצָמָ֣יו אֵתָֽן׃
translations.english:
He is reproved by pains on his bed,
And the trembling in his bones is constant.

translations.hebrew: וְזִהֲמַ֣תּוּ חַיָּת֣וֹ לָ֑חֶם וְ֝נַפְשׁ֗וֹ מַאֲכַ֥ל תַּאֲוָֽה׃
translations.english:
He detests food;
Fine food [is repulsive] to him.

translations.hebrew: יִ֣כֶל בְּשָׂר֣וֹ מֵרֹ֑אִי (ושפי) [וְשֻׁפּ֥וּ] עַ֝צְמֹתָ֗יו לֹ֣א רֻאּֽוּ׃
translations.english:
His flesh wastes away till it cannot be seen,
And his bones are rubbed away till they are invisible.

translations.hebrew: וַתִּקְרַ֣ב לַשַּׁ֣חַת נַפְשׁ֑וֹ וְ֝חַיָּת֗וֹ לַֽמְמִתִֽים׃
translations.english:
He comes close to the Pit,
His life [verges] on death.

translations.hebrew: אִם־יֵ֤שׁ עָלָ֨יו ׀ מַלְאָ֗ךְ מֵלִ֗יץ אֶחָ֥ד מִנִּי־אָ֑לֶף לְהַגִּ֖יד לְאָדָ֣ם יׇשְׁרֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
If he has a representative,
One advocate against a thousand
To declare the man’s uprightness,

translations.hebrew: וַיְחֻנֶּ֗נּוּ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר פְּ֭דָעֵהוּ מֵרֶ֥דֶת שָׁ֗חַת מָצָ֥אתִי כֹֽפֶר׃
translations.english:
Then He has mercy on him and decrees,
“Redeem him from descending to the Pit,
For I have obtained his ransom;

translations.hebrew: רֻֽטְפַ֣שׁ בְּשָׂר֣וֹ מִנֹּ֑עַר יָ֝שׁ֗וּב לִימֵ֥י עֲלוּמָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Let his flesh be healthierbMeaning of Heb. uncertain. than in his youth;
Let him return to his younger days.”

translations.hebrew: יֶעְתַּ֤ר אֶל־אֱל֨וֹהַּ ׀ וַיִּרְצֵ֗הוּ וַיַּ֣רְא פָּ֭נָיו בִּתְרוּעָ֑ה וַיָּ֥שֶׁב לֶ֝אֱנ֗וֹשׁ צִדְקָתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He prays to God and is accepted by Him;
He enters His presence with shouts of joy,
For He requites a man for his righteousness.
