translations.hebrew: יָשֹׁ֤ר ׀ עַל־אֲנָשִׁ֗ים וַיֹּ֗אמֶר חָ֭טָאתִי וְיָשָׁ֥ר הֶעֱוֵ֗יתִי וְלֹא־שָׁ֥וָה לִֽי׃
translations.english:
HecI.e., the contrite man. declaresbMeaning of Heb. uncertain. to men,
“I have sinned; I have perverted what was right;
But I was not paid back for it.”

translations.hebrew: פָּדָ֣ה (נפשי) [נַ֭פְשׁוֹ] מֵעֲבֹ֣ר בַּשָּׁ֑חַת (וחיתי) [וְ֝חַיָּת֗וֹ] בָּא֥וֹר תִּרְאֶֽה׃
translations.english:
He redeemed dOr with kethib, “me…I.”him from passing into the Pit;
He-d will enjoy the light.

translations.hebrew: הֶן־כׇּל־אֵ֭לֶּה יִפְעַל־אֵ֑ל פַּעֲמַ֖יִם שָׁל֣וֹשׁ עִם־גָּֽבֶר׃
translations.english:
Truly, God does all these things
Two or three times to a man,

translations.hebrew: לְהָשִׁ֣יב נַ֭פְשׁוֹ מִנִּי־שָׁ֑חַת לֵ֝א֗וֹר בְּא֣וֹר הַחַיִּֽים׃
translations.english:
To bring him back from the Pit,
That he may bask in the light of life.

translations.hebrew: הַקְשֵׁ֖ב אִיּ֥וֹב שְֽׁמַֽע־לִ֑י הַ֝חֲרֵ֗שׁ וְאָנֹכִ֥י אֲדַבֵּֽר׃
translations.english:
Pay heed, Job, and hear me;
Be still, and I will speak;

translations.hebrew: אִם־יֵשׁ־מִלִּ֥ין הֲשִׁיבֵ֑נִי דַּ֝בֵּ֗ר כִּֽי־חָפַ֥צְתִּי צַדְּקֶֽךָּ׃
translations.english:
If you have what to say, answer me;
Speak, for I am eager to vindicate you.

translations.hebrew: אִם־אַ֭יִן אַתָּ֥ה שְֽׁמַֽע־לִ֑י הַ֝חֲרֵ֗שׁ וַאֲאַלֶּפְךָ֥ חׇכְמָֽה׃
translations.english:
But if not, you listen to me;
Be still, and I will teach you wisdom.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן אֱלִיה֗וּא וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
translations.english: Elihu said in reply:

translations.hebrew: שִׁמְע֣וּ חֲכָמִ֣ים מִלָּ֑י וְ֝יֹדְעִ֗ים הַאֲזִ֥ינוּ לִֽי׃
translations.english:
Listen, O wise men, to my words;
You who have knowledge, give ear to me.

translations.hebrew: כִּי־אֹ֭זֶן מִלִּ֣ין תִּבְחָ֑ן וְ֝חֵ֗ךְ יִטְעַ֥ם לֶאֱכֹֽל׃
translations.english:
For the ear tests arguments
As the palate tastes food.

translations.hebrew: מִשְׁפָּ֥ט נִבְחֲרָה־לָּ֑נוּ נֵדְעָ֖ה בֵינֵ֣ינוּ מַה־טּֽוֹב׃
translations.english:
Let us decide for ourselves what is just;
Let us know among ourselves what is good.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אָמַ֣ר אִיּ֣וֹב צָדַ֑קְתִּי וְ֝אֵ֗ל הֵסִ֥יר מִשְׁפָּטִֽי׃
translations.english:
For Job has said, “I am right;
God has deprived me of justice.

translations.hebrew: עַל־מִשְׁפָּטִ֥י אֲכַזֵּ֑ב אָנ֖וּשׁ חִצִּ֣י בְלִי־פָֽשַׁע׃
translations.english:
I declare the judgment against me false;
My arrow-wound is deadly, though I am free from transgression.”

translations.hebrew: מִי־גֶ֥בֶר כְּאִיּ֑וֹב יִֽשְׁתֶּה־לַּ֥עַג כַּמָּֽיִם׃
translations.english:
What man is like Job,
Who drinks mockery like water;

translations.hebrew: וְאָרַ֣ח לְ֭חֶבְרָה עִם־פֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָ֑וֶן וְ֝לָלֶ֗כֶת עִם־אַנְשֵׁי־רֶֽשַׁע׃
translations.english:
Who makes common cause with evildoers,
And goes with wicked men?

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אָ֭מַר לֹ֣א יִסְכׇּן־גָּ֑בֶר בִּ֝רְצֹת֗וֹ עִם־אֱלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
For he says, “Man gains nothing
When he is in God’s favor.”

translations.hebrew: לָכֵ֤ן ׀ אַ֥נְשֵׁ֥י לֵבָ֗ב שִׁמְע֫וּ־לִ֥י חָלִ֖לָה לָאֵ֥ל מֵרֶ֗שַׁע וְשַׁדַּ֥י מֵעָֽוֶל׃
translations.english:
Therefore, men of understanding, listen to me;
Wickedness be far from God,
Wrongdoing, from Shaddai!

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י פֹ֣עַל אָ֭דָם יְשַׁלֶּם־ל֑וֹ וּֽכְאֹ֥רַח אִ֝֗ישׁ יַמְצִאֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
For He pays a man according to his actions,
And provides for him according to his conduct;

translations.hebrew: אַף־אׇמְנָ֗ם אֵ֥ל לֹֽא־יַרְשִׁ֑יעַ וְ֝שַׁדַּ֗י לֹא־יְעַוֵּ֥ת מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
translations.english:
For God surely does not act wickedly;
Shaddai does not pervert justice.

translations.hebrew: מִֽי־פָקַ֣ד עָלָ֣יו אָ֑רְצָה וּמִ֥י שָׂ֝֗ם תֵּבֵ֥ל כֻּלָּֽהּ׃
translations.english:
Who placed the earth in His charge?
Who ordered the entire world?

translations.hebrew: אִם־יָשִׂ֣ים אֵלָ֣יו לִבּ֑וֹ רוּח֥וֹ וְ֝נִשְׁמָת֗וֹ אֵלָ֥יו יֶאֱסֹֽף׃
translations.english:
If He but intends it,
He can call back His spirit and breath;

translations.hebrew: יִגְוַ֣ע כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֣ר יָ֑חַד וְ֝אָדָ֗ם עַל־עָפָ֥ר יָשֽׁוּב׃
translations.english:
All flesh would at once expire,
And mankind return to dust.

translations.hebrew: וְאִם־בִּ֥ינָה שִׁמְעָה־זֹּ֑את הַ֝אֲזִ֗ינָה לְק֣וֹל מִלָּֽי׃
translations.english:
If you would understand, listen to this;
Give ear to what I say.

translations.hebrew: הַאַ֬ף שׂוֹנֵ֣א מִשְׁפָּ֣ט יַחֲב֑וֹשׁ וְאִם־צַדִּ֖יק כַּבִּ֣יר תַּרְשִֽׁיעַ׃
translations.english:
Would one who hates justice govern?
Would you condemn the Just Mighty One?

translations.hebrew: הַאֲמֹ֣ר לְמֶ֣לֶךְ בְּלִיָּ֑עַל רָ֝שָׁ֗ע אֶל־נְדִיבִֽים׃
translations.english:
Would you call a king a scoundrel,
Great men, wicked?

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־נָשָׂ֨א ׀ פְּנֵ֥י שָׂרִ֗ים וְלֹ֣א נִכַּר־שׁ֭וֹעַ לִפְנֵי־דָ֑ל כִּֽי־מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה יָדָ֣יו כֻּלָּֽם׃
translations.english:
He is not partial to princes;
The noble are not preferred to the wretched;
For all of them are the work of His hands.

translations.hebrew: רֶ֤גַע ׀ יָמֻתוּ֮ וַחֲצ֢וֹת לָ֥֫יְלָה יְגֹעֲשׁ֣וּ עָ֣ם וְיַעֲבֹ֑רוּ וְיָסִ֥ירוּ אַ֝בִּ֗יר לֹ֣א בְיָֽד׃
translations.english:
Some die suddenly in the middle of the night;
People are in turmoil and pass on;
Even great men are removed—not by human hands.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־עֵ֭ינָיו עַל־דַּרְכֵי־אִ֑ישׁ וְֽכׇל־צְעָדָ֥יו יִרְאֶֽה׃
translations.english:
For His eyes are upon a man’s ways;
He observes his every step.

translations.hebrew: אֵֽין־חֹ֭שֶׁךְ וְאֵ֣ין צַלְמָ֑וֶת לְהִסָּ֥תֶר שָׁ֝֗ם פֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
translations.english:
Neither darkness nor gloom offers
A hiding-place for evildoers.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א עַל־אִ֭ישׁ יָשִׂ֣ים ע֑וֹד לַהֲלֹ֥ךְ אֶל־אֵ֝֗ל בַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
translations.english:
He has no set time for man
To appear before God in judgment.

translations.hebrew: יָרֹ֣עַ כַּבִּירִ֣ים לֹא־חֵ֑קֶר וַיַּעֲמֵ֖ד אֲחֵרִ֣ים תַּחְתָּֽם׃
translations.english:
He shatters mighty men without number
And sets others in their place.

translations.hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן יַ֭כִּיר מַעְבָּדֵיהֶ֑ם וְהָ֥פַךְ לַ֝֗יְלָה וְיִדַּכָּֽאוּ׃
translations.english:
Truly, He knows their deeds;
Night is over, and they are crushed.

translations.hebrew: תַּֽחַת־רְשָׁעִ֥ים סְפָקָ֗ם בִּמְק֥וֹם רֹאִֽים׃
translations.english:
He strikes them down with the wicked
Where people can see,

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־כֵּ֭ן סָ֣רוּ מֵאַחֲרָ֑יו וְכׇל־דְּ֝רָכָ֗יו לֹ֣א הִשְׂכִּֽילוּ׃
translations.english:
Because they have been disloyal to Him
And have not understood any of His ways;

translations.hebrew: לְהָבִ֣יא עָ֭לָיו צַעֲקַת־דָּ֑ל וְצַעֲקַ֖ת עֲנִיִּ֣ים יִשְׁמָֽע׃
translations.english:
Thus He lets the cry of the poor come before Him;
He listens to the cry of the needy.

translations.hebrew: וְה֤וּא יַשְׁקִ֨ט ׀ וּמִ֥י יַרְשִׁ֗עַ וְיַסְתֵּ֣ר פָּ֭נִים וּמִ֣י יְשׁוּרֶ֑נּוּ וְעַל־גּ֖וֹי וְעַל־אָדָ֣ם יָֽחַד׃
translations.english:
When He is silent, who will condemn?
If He hides His face, who will see Him,
Be it nation or man?

translations.hebrew: מִ֭מְּלֹךְ אָדָ֥ם חָנֵ֗ף מִמֹּ֥קְשֵׁי עָֽם׃
translations.english:
The impious man rules no more,
Nor do those who ensnare the people.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אֶל־אֵ֭ל הֶאָמַ֥ר נָשָׂ֗אתִי לֹ֣א אֶחְבֹּֽל׃
translations.english:
Has he said to God,
“I will bear [my punishment] and offend no more.

translations.hebrew: בִּלְעֲדֵ֣י אֶ֭חֱזֶה אַתָּ֣ה הֹרֵ֑נִי אִֽם־עָ֥וֶל פָּ֝עַ֗לְתִּי לֹ֣א אֹסִֽיף׃
translations.english:
What I cannot see You teach me.
If I have done iniquity, I shall not do so again”?

translations.hebrew: הֲֽמֵעִמְּךָ֬ יְשַׁלְּמֶ֨נָּה ׀ כִּֽי־מָאַ֗סְתָּ כִּֽי־אַתָּ֣ה תִבְחַ֣ר וְלֹא־אָ֑נִי וּֽמַה־יָּדַ֥עְתָּ דַבֵּֽר׃
translations.english:
Should He requite as you see fit?
But you have despised [Him]!
You must decide, not I;
Speak what you know.

translations.hebrew: אַנְשֵׁ֣י לֵ֭בָב יֹ֣אמְרוּ לִ֑י וְגֶ֥בֶר חָ֝כָ֗ם שֹׁמֵ֥עַֽ לִֽי׃
translations.english:
Men of understanding say to me,
Wise men who hear me,

translations.hebrew: אִ֭יּוֹב לֹא־בְדַ֣עַת יְדַבֵּ֑ר וּ֝דְבָרָ֗יו לֹ֣א בְהַשְׂכֵּֽיל׃
translations.english:
“Job does not speak with knowledge;
His words lack understanding.”

translations.hebrew: אָבִ֗י יִבָּחֵ֣ן אִיּ֣וֹב עַד־נֶ֑צַח עַל־תְּ֝שֻׁבֹ֗ת בְּאַנְשֵׁי־אָֽוֶן׃
translations.english:
Would that Job were tried to the limit
For answers which befit sinful men.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֥י־יֹ֘סִ֤יף עַֽל־חַטָּאת֣וֹ פֶ֭שַׁע בֵּינֵ֣ינוּ יִשְׂפּ֑וֹק וְיֶ֖רֶב אֲמָרָ֣יו לָאֵֽל׃
translations.english:
He adds to his sin;
He increases his transgression among us;
He multiplies his statements against God.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן אֱלִיה֗וּ וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
translations.english: Elihu said in reply:

translations.hebrew: הֲ֭זֹאת חָשַׁ֣בְתָּ לְמִשְׁפָּ֑ט אָ֝מַ֗רְתָּ צִדְקִ֥י מֵאֵֽל׃
translations.english:
Do you think it just
To say, “I am right against God”?

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־תֹ֭אמַר מַה־יִּסְכׇּן־לָ֑ךְ מָה־אֹ֝עִ֗יל מֵחַטָּאתִֽי׃
translations.english:
If you ask how it benefits you,
“What have I gained from not sinning?”

translations.hebrew: אֲ֭נִי אֲשִֽׁיבְךָ֣ מִלִּ֑ין וְֽאֶת־רֵעֶ֥יךָ עִמָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
I shall give you a reply,
You, along with your friends.

translations.hebrew: הַבֵּ֣ט שָׁמַ֣יִם וּרְאֵ֑ה וְשׁ֥וּר שְׁ֝חָקִ֗ים גָּבְה֥וּ מִמֶּֽךָּ׃
translations.english:
Behold the heavens and see;
Look at the skies high above you.

translations.hebrew: אִם־חָ֭טָאתָ מַה־תִּפְעׇל־בּ֑וֹ וְרַבּ֥וּ פְ֝שָׁעֶ֗יךָ מַה־תַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
If you sin, what do you do to Him?
If your transgressions are many,
How do you affect Him?

translations.hebrew: אִם־צָ֭דַקְתָּ מַה־תִּתֶּן־ל֑וֹ א֥וֹ מַה־מִּיָּדְךָ֥ יִקָּֽח׃
translations.english:
If you are righteous,
What do you give Him;
What does He receive from your hand?

translations.hebrew: לְאִישׁ־כָּמ֥וֹךָ רִשְׁעֶ֑ךָ וּלְבֶן־אָ֝דָ֗ם צִדְקָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Your wickedness affects men like yourself;
Your righteousness, mortals.

translations.hebrew: מֵ֭רֹב עֲשׁוּקִ֣ים יַזְעִ֑יקוּ יְשַׁוְּע֖וּ מִזְּר֣וֹעַ רַבִּֽים׃
translations.english:
Because of contention the oppressed cry out;
They shout because of the power of the great.

translations.hebrew: וְֽלֹא־אָמַ֗ר אַ֭יֵּה אֱל֣וֹהַּ עֹשָׂ֑י נֹתֵ֖ן זְמִר֣וֹת בַּלָּֽיְלָה׃
translations.english:
But none says, “Where is my God, my Maker,
Who gives strength in the night;

translations.hebrew: מַ֭לְּפֵנוּ מִבַּהֲמ֣וֹת אָ֑רֶץ וּמֵע֖וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם יְחַכְּמֵֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
Who gives us more knowledge than the beasts of the earth,
Makes us wiser than the birds of the sky?”

translations.hebrew: שָׁ֣ם יִ֭צְעֲקוּ וְלֹ֣א יַעֲנֶ֑ה מִ֝פְּנֵ֗י גְּא֣וֹן רָעִֽים׃
translations.english:
Then they cry out, but He does not respond
Because of the arrogance of evil men.

translations.hebrew: אַךְ־שָׁ֭וְא לֹא־יִשְׁמַ֥ע <small>׀</small> אֵ֑ל וְ֝שַׁדַּ֗י לֹ֣א יְשׁוּרֶֽנָּה׃
translations.english:
Surely it is false that God does not listen,
That Shaddai does not take note of it.

translations.hebrew: אַ֣ף כִּֽי־תֹ֭אמַר לֹ֣א תְשׁוּרֶ֑נּוּ דִּ֥ין לְ֝פָנָ֗יו וּתְח֥וֹלֵֽל לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Though you say, “You do not take note of it,”
The case is before Him;
So wait for Him.

translations.hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה כִּי־אַ֭יִן פָּקַ֣ד אַפּ֑וֹ וְלֹֽא־יָדַ֖ע בַּפַּ֣שׁ מְאֹֽד׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.But since now it does not seem so,
He vents his anger;
He does not realize that it may be long drawn out.-a

translations.hebrew: וְ֭אִיּוֹב הֶ֣בֶל יִפְצֶה־פִּ֑יהוּ בִּבְלִי־דַ֝֗עַת מִלִּ֥ין יַכְבִּֽר׃
translations.english:
Hence Job mouths empty words,
And piles up words without knowledge.

translations.hebrew: וַיֹּ֥סֶף אֱלִיה֗וּא וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
translations.english: Then Elihu spoke once more.

translations.hebrew: כַּתַּר־לִ֣י זְ֭עֵיר וַאֲחַוֶּ֑ךָּ כִּ֤י ע֖וֹד לֶאֱל֣וֹהַּ מִלִּֽים׃
translations.english:
Wait a little and let me hold forth;
There is still more to say for God.

translations.hebrew: אֶשָּׂ֣א דֵ֭עִי לְמֵרָח֑וֹק וּ֝לְפֹעֲלִ֗י אֶֽתֵּֽן־צֶֽדֶק׃
translations.english:
I will make my opinions widely known;
I will justify my Maker.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אׇ֭מְנָם לֹא־שֶׁ֣קֶר מִלָּ֑י תְּמִ֖ים דֵּע֣וֹת עִמָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
In truth, my words are not false;
A man of sound opinions is before you.

translations.hebrew: הֶן־אֵ֣ל כַּ֭בִּיר וְלֹ֣א יִמְאָ֑ס כַּ֝בִּ֗יר כֹּ֣חַֽ לֵֽב׃
translations.english:
See, God is mighty; He is not contemptuous;
He is mighty in strength and mind.

translations.hebrew: לֹא־יְחַיֶּ֥ה רָשָׁ֑ע וּמִשְׁפַּ֖ט עֲנִיִּ֣ים יִתֵּֽן׃
translations.english:
He does not let the wicked live;
He grants justice to the lowly.

translations.hebrew: לֹֽא־יִגְרַ֥ע מִצַּדִּ֗יק עֵ֫ינָ֥יו וְאֶת־מְלָכִ֥ים לַכִּסֵּ֑א וַיֹּשִׁיבֵ֥ם לָ֝נֶ֗צַח וַיִּגְבָּֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
He does not withdraw His eyes from the righteous;
With kings on thrones
He seats them forever, and they are exalted.

translations.hebrew: וְאִם־אֲסוּרִ֥ים בַּזִּקִּ֑ים יִ֝לָּכְד֗וּן בְּחַבְלֵי־עֹֽנִי׃
translations.english:
If they are bound in shackles
And caught in trammels of affliction,

translations.hebrew: וַיַּגֵּ֣ד לָהֶ֣ם פׇּעֳלָ֑ם וּ֝פִשְׁעֵיהֶ֗ם כִּ֣י יִתְגַּבָּֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
He declares to them what they have done,
And that their transgressions are excessive;

translations.hebrew: וַיִּ֣גֶל אׇ֭זְנָם לַמּוּסָ֑ר וַ֝יֹּ֗אמֶר כִּֽי־יְשׁוּב֥וּן מֵאָֽוֶן׃
translations.english:
He opens their understanding by discipline,
And orders them back from mischief.

translations.hebrew: אִֽם־יִשְׁמְע֗וּ וְֽיַ֫עֲבֹ֥דוּ יְכַלּ֣וּ יְמֵיהֶ֣ם בַּטּ֑וֹב וּ֝שְׁנֵיהֶ֗ם בַּנְּעִימִֽים׃
translations.english:
If they will serve obediently,
They shall spend their days in happiness,
Their years in delight.

translations.hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֣א יִ֭שְׁמְעוּ בְּשֶׁ֣לַח יַעֲבֹ֑רוּ וְ֝יִגְוְע֗וּ בִּבְלִי־דָֽעַת׃
translations.english:
But if they are not obedient,
They shall perish by the sword,
Die for lack of understanding.

translations.hebrew: וְֽחַנְפֵי־לֵ֭ב יָשִׂ֣ימוּ אָ֑ף לֹ֥א יְ֝שַׁוְּע֗וּ כִּ֣י אֲסָרָֽם׃
translations.english:
But the impious in heart become enraged;
They do not cry for help when He afflicts them.

translations.hebrew: תָּמֹ֣ת בַּנֹּ֣עַר נַפְשָׁ֑ם וְ֝חַיָּתָ֗ם בַּקְּדֵשִֽׁים׃
translations.english:
They die in their youth;
[Expire] among the depraved.

translations.hebrew: יְחַלֵּ֣ץ עָנִ֣י בְעׇנְי֑וֹ וְיִ֖גֶל בַּלַּ֣חַץ אׇזְנָֽם׃
translations.english:
He rescues the lowly from their affliction,
And opens their understanding through distress.

translations.hebrew: וְאַ֤ף הֲסִֽיתְךָ֨ ׀ מִפִּי־צָ֗ר רַ֭חַב לֹא־מוּצָ֣ק תַּחְתֶּ֑יהָ וְנַ֥חַת שֻׁ֝לְחָנְךָ֗ מָ֣לֵא דָֽשֶׁן׃
translations.english:
Indeed, He draws you away from the brink of distress
To a broad place where there is no constraint;
Your table is laid out with rich food.

translations.hebrew: וְדִין־רָשָׁ֥ע מָלֵ֑אתָ דִּ֖ין וּמִשְׁפָּ֣ט יִתְמֹֽכוּ׃
translations.english:
You are obsessed with the case of the wicked man,
But the justice of the case will be upheld.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־חֵ֭מָה פֶּן־יְסִֽיתְךָ֣ בְסָ֑פֶק וְרׇב־כֹּ֝֗פֶר אַל־יַטֶּֽךָּ׃
translations.english:
Let anger at his affluence not mislead you;
Let much bribery not turn you aside.

translations.hebrew: הֲיַעֲרֹ֣ךְ שׁ֭וּעֲךָ לֹ֣א בְצָ֑ר וְ֝כֹ֗ל מַאֲמַצֵּי־כֹֽחַ׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Will your limitless wealth avail you,-a
All your powerful efforts?

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּשְׁאַ֥ף הַלָּ֑יְלָה לַעֲל֖וֹת עַמִּ֣ים תַּחְתָּֽם׃
translations.english:
Do not long for the night
When peoples vanish where they are.

translations.hebrew: הִ֭שָּׁמֶר אַל־תֵּ֣פֶן אֶל־אָ֑וֶן כִּֽי־עַל־זֶ֝֗ה בָּחַ֥רְתָּ מֵעֹֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Beware! Do not turn to mischief;
Because of that you have been tried by affliction.

translations.hebrew: הֶן־אֵ֭ל יַשְׂגִּ֣יב בְּכֹח֑וֹ מִ֖י כָמֹ֣הוּ מוֹרֶֽה׃
translations.english:
See, God is beyond reach in His power;
Who governs like Him?

translations.hebrew: מִֽי־פָקַ֣ד עָלָ֣יו דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וּמִי־אָ֝מַ֗ר פָּעַ֥לְתָּ עַוְלָֽה׃
translations.english:
Who ever reproached Him for His conduct?
Who ever said, “You have done wrong”?

translations.hebrew: זְ֭כֹר כִּֽי־תַשְׂגִּ֣יא פׇעֳל֑וֹ אֲשֶׁ֖ר שֹׁרְר֣וּ אֲנָשִֽׁים׃
translations.english:
Remember, then, to magnify His work,
Of which men have sung,

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־אָדָ֥ם חָזוּ־ב֑וֹ אֱ֝נ֗וֹשׁ יַבִּ֥יט מֵרָחֽוֹק׃
translations.english:
Which all men have beheld,
Men have seen, from a distance.

translations.hebrew: הֶן־אֵ֣ל שַׂ֭גִּיא וְלֹ֣א נֵדָ֑ע מִסְפַּ֖ר שָׁנָ֣יו וְלֹא־חֵֽקֶר׃
translations.english:
See, God is greater than we can know;
The number of His years cannot be counted.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֭י יְגָרַ֣ע נִטְפֵי־מָ֑יִם יָזֹ֖קּוּ מָטָ֣ר לְאֵדֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He forms the droplets of water,
Which cluster into rain, from His mist.

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶֽׁר־יִזְּל֥וּ שְׁחָקִ֑ים יִ֝רְעֲפ֗וּ עֲלֵ֤י ׀ אָדָ֬ם רָֽב׃
translations.english:
The skies rain;
They pour down on all mankind.

translations.hebrew: אַ֣ף אִם־יָ֭בִין מִפְרְשֵׂי־עָ֑ב תְּ֝שֻׁא֗וֹת סֻכָּתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Can one, indeed, contemplate the expanse of clouds,
The thunderings from His pavilion?

translations.hebrew: הֵן־פָּרַ֣שׂ עָלָ֣יו אוֹר֑וֹ וְשׇׁרְשֵׁ֖י הַיָּ֣ם כִּסָּֽה׃
translations.english:
See, He spreads His lightning over it;
It fills the bed of the sea.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־בָ֭ם יָדִ֣ין עַמִּ֑ים יִֽתֶּן־אֹ֥כֶל לְמַכְבִּֽיר׃
translations.english:
By these things He controls peoples;
He gives food in abundance.

translations.hebrew: עַל־כַּפַּ֥יִם כִּסָּה־א֑וֹר וַיְצַ֖ו עָלֶ֣יהָ בְמַפְגִּֽיעַ׃
translations.english:
Lightning fills His hands;
He orders it to hit the mark.

translations.hebrew: יַגִּ֣יד עָלָ֣יו רֵע֑וֹ מִ֝קְנֶ֗ה אַ֣ף עַל־עוֹלֶֽה׃
translations.english:
Its noise tells of Him.
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.The kindling of anger against iniquity.-a

translations.hebrew: אַף־לְ֭זֹאת יֶחֱרַ֣ד לִבִּ֑י וְ֝יִתַּ֗ר מִמְּקוֹמֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Because of this, too, my heart quakes,
And leaps from its place.

translations.hebrew: שִׁמְע֤וּ שָׁמ֣וֹעַ בְּרֹ֣גֶז קֹל֑וֹ וְ֝הֶ֗גֶה מִפִּ֥יו יֵצֵֽא׃
translations.english:
Just listen to the noise of His rumbling,
To the sound that comes out of His mouth.

translations.hebrew: תַּֽחַת־כׇּל־הַשָּׁמַ֥יִם יִשְׁרֵ֑הוּ וְ֝אוֹר֗וֹ עַל־כַּנְפ֥וֹת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
He lets it loose beneath the entire heavens—
His lightning, to the ends of the earth.

translations.hebrew: אַחֲרָ֤יו ׀ יִשְׁאַג־ק֗וֹל יַ֭רְעֵם בְּק֣וֹל גְּאוֹנ֑וֹ וְלֹ֥א יְ֝עַקְּבֵ֗ם כִּֽי־יִשָּׁמַ֥ע קוֹלֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
After it, He lets out a roar;
He thunders in His majestic voice.
No one can find a trace of it by the time His voice is heard.

translations.hebrew: יַרְעֵ֤ם אֵ֣ל בְּ֭קוֹלוֹ נִפְלָא֑וֹת עֹשֶׂ֥ה גְ֝דֹל֗וֹת וְלֹ֣א נֵדָֽע׃
translations.english:
God thunders marvelously with His voice;
He works wonders that we cannot understand.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י לַשֶּׁ֨לֶג ׀ יֹאמַ֗ר הֱוֵ֫א־אָ֥רֶץ וְגֶ֥שֶׁם מָטָ֑ר וְ֝גֶ֗שֶׁם מִטְר֥וֹת עֻזּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He commands the snow, “Fall to the ground!”
And the downpour of rain, His mighty downpour of rain,

translations.hebrew: בְּיַד־כׇּל־אָדָ֥ם יַחְתּ֑וֹם לָ֝דַ֗עַת כׇּל־אַנְשֵׁ֥י מַעֲשֵֽׂהוּ׃
translations.english:
Is as a sign on every man’s hand,
That all men may know His doings.

translations.hebrew: וַתָּב֣וֹא חַיָּ֣ה בְמוֹ־אָ֑רֶב וּבִמְע֖וֹנֹתֶ֣יהָ תִשְׁכֹּֽן׃
translations.english:
Then the beast enters its lair,
And remains in its den.

translations.hebrew: מִן־הַ֭חֶדֶר תָּב֣וֹא סוּפָ֑ה וּֽמִמְּזָרִ֥ים קָרָֽה׃
translations.english:
The storm wind comes from its chamber,
And the cold from the constellations.

translations.hebrew: מִנִּשְׁמַת־אֵ֥ל יִתֶּן־קָ֑רַח וְרֹ֖חַב מַ֣יִם בְּמוּצָֽק׃
translations.english:
By the breath of God ice is formed,
And the expanse of water becomes solid.

translations.hebrew: אַף־בְּ֭רִי יַטְרִ֣יחַ עָ֑ב יָ֝פִ֗יץ עֲנַ֣ן אוֹרֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He also loads the clouds with moisture
And scatters His lightning-clouds.

translations.hebrew: וְה֤וּא מְסִבּ֨וֹת ׀ מִתְהַפֵּ֣ךְ בְּתַחְבּוּלֹתָ֣ו לְפׇעֳלָ֑ם כֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְצַוֵּ֓ם ׀ עַל־פְּנֵ֖י תֵבֵ֣ל אָֽרְצָה׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.He keeps turning events by His stratagems,-a
That they might accomplish all that He commands them
Throughout the inhabited earth,

translations.hebrew: אִם־לְשֵׁ֥בֶט אִם־לְאַרְצ֑וֹ אִם־לְ֝חֶ֗סֶד יַמְצִאֵֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
Causing each of them to happen to His land,
Whether as a scourge or as a blessing.

translations.hebrew: הַאֲזִ֣ינָה זֹּ֣את אִיּ֑וֹב עֲ֝מֹ֗ד וְהִתְבּוֹנֵ֤ן ׀ נִפְלְא֬וֹת אֵֽל׃
translations.english:
Give ear to this, Job;
Stop to consider the marvels of God.

translations.hebrew: הֲ֭תֵדַע בְּשׂוּם־אֱל֣וֹהַּ עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וְ֝הֹפִ֗יעַ א֣וֹר עֲנָנֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Do you know what charge God lays upon them
When His lightning-clouds shine?

translations.hebrew: הֲ֭תֵדַע עַל־מִפְלְשֵׂי־עָ֑ב מִ֝פְלְא֗וֹת תְּמִ֣ים דֵּעִֽים׃
translations.english:
Do you know the marvels worked upon the expanse of clouds
By Him whose understanding is perfect,

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־בְּגָדֶ֥יךָ חַמִּ֑ים בְּהַשְׁקִ֥ט אֶ֝֗רֶץ מִדָּרֽוֹם׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Why your clothes become hot-a
When the land is becalmed by the south wind?

translations.hebrew: תַּרְקִ֣יעַ עִ֭מּוֹ לִשְׁחָקִ֑ים חֲ֝זָקִ֗ים כִּרְאִ֥י מוּצָֽק׃
translations.english:
Can you help him stretch out the heavens,
Firm as a mirror of cast metal?

translations.hebrew: ה֭וֹדִיעֵנוּ מַה־נֹּ֣אמַר ל֑וֹ לֹֽא־נַ֝עֲרֹ֗ךְ מִפְּנֵי־חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃
translations.english:
Inform us, then, what we may say to Him;
We cannot argue because [we are in] darkness.

translations.hebrew: הַֽיְסֻפַּר־ל֭וֹ כִּ֣י אֲדַבֵּ֑ר אִֽם־אָ֥מַר אִ֝֗ישׁ כִּ֣י יְבֻלָּֽע׃
translations.english:
Is anything conveyed to Him when I speak?
Can a man say anything when he is confused?

translations.hebrew: וְעַתָּ֤ה ׀ לֹ֘א־רָ֤אוּ א֗וֹר בָּהִ֣יר ה֭וּא בַּשְּׁחָקִ֑ים וְר֥וּחַ עָ֝בְרָ֗ה וַֽתְּטַהֲרֵֽם׃
translations.english:
Now, then, one cannot see the sun,
Though it be bright in the heavens,
Until the wind comes and clears them [of clouds].

translations.hebrew: מִ֭צָּפוֹן זָהָ֣ב יֶאֱתֶ֑ה עַל־אֱ֝ל֗וֹהַּ נ֣וֹרָא הֽוֹד׃
translations.english:
By the north wind the golden rays emerge;
The splendor about God is awesome.

translations.hebrew: שַׁדַּ֣י לֹא־מְ֭צָאנֻהוּ שַׂגִּיא־כֹ֑חַ וּמִשְׁפָּ֥ט וְרֹב־צְ֝דָקָ֗ה לֹ֣א יְעַנֶּֽה׃
translations.english:
Shaddai—we cannot attain to Him;
He is great in power and justice
And abundant in righteousness; He does not torment.

translations.hebrew: לָ֭כֵן יְרֵא֣וּהוּ אֲנָשִׁ֑ים לֹֽא־יִ֝רְאֶ֗ה כׇּל־חַכְמֵי־לֵֽב׃
translations.english:
Therefore, men are in awe of Him
Whom none of the wise can perceive.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּעַן־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֶת־אִ֭יּוֹב (מנהסערה) [מִ֥ן ׀ הַסְּעָרָ֗ה] וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
translations.english: Then the LORD replied to Job out of the tempest and said:

translations.hebrew: מִ֤י זֶ֨ה ׀ מַחְשִׁ֖יךְ עֵצָ֥ה בְמִלִּ֗ין בְּֽלִי־דָֽעַת׃
translations.english:
Who is this who darkens counsel,
Speaking without knowledge?

translations.hebrew: אֱזׇר־נָ֣א כְגֶ֣בֶר חֲלָצֶ֑יךָ וְ֝אֶשְׁאָלְךָ֗ וְהוֹדִיעֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Gird your loins like a man;
I will ask and you will inform Me.

translations.hebrew: אֵיפֹ֣ה הָ֭יִיתָ בְּיׇסְדִי־אָ֑רֶץ הַ֝גֵּ֗ד אִם־יָדַ֥עְתָּ בִינָֽה׃
translations.english:
Where were you when I laid the earth’s foundations?
Speak if you have understanding.

translations.hebrew: מִי־שָׂ֣ם מְ֭מַדֶּיהָ כִּ֣י תֵדָ֑ע א֤וֹ מִֽי־נָטָ֖ה עָלֶ֣יהָ קָּֽו׃
translations.english:
Do you know who fixed its dimensions
Or who measured it with a line?

translations.hebrew: עַל־מָ֭ה אֲדָנֶ֣יהָ הׇטְבָּ֑עוּ א֥וֹ מִי־יָ֝רָ֗ה אֶ֣בֶן פִּנָּתָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
Onto what were its bases sunk?
Who set its cornerstone

translations.hebrew: בְּרׇן־יַ֭חַד כּ֣וֹכְבֵי בֹ֑קֶר וַ֝יָּרִ֗יעוּ כׇּל־בְּנֵ֥י אֱלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
When the morning stars sang together
And all the divine beings shouted for joy?

translations.hebrew: וַיָּ֣סֶךְ בִּדְלָתַ֣יִם יָ֑ם בְּ֝גִיח֗וֹ מֵרֶ֥חֶם יֵצֵֽא׃
translations.english:
Who closed the sea behind doors
When it gushed forth out of the womb,

translations.hebrew: בְּשׂוּמִ֣י עָנָ֣ן לְבֻשׁ֑וֹ וַ֝עֲרָפֶ֗ל חֲתֻלָּתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
When I clothed it in clouds,
Swaddled it in dense clouds,

translations.hebrew: וָאֶשְׁבֹּ֣ר עָלָ֣יו חֻקִּ֑י וָ֝אָשִׂ֗ים בְּרִ֣יחַ וּדְלָתָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
When I made breakers My limit for it,
And set up its bar and doors,

translations.hebrew: וָאֹמַ֗ר עַד־פֹּ֣ה תָ֭בוֹא וְלֹ֣א תֹסִ֑יף וּפֹא־יָ֝שִׁ֗ית בִּגְא֥וֹן גַּלֶּֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
And said, “You may come so far and no farther;
Here your surging waves will stop”?

translations.hebrew: הֲֽ֭מִיָּמֶיךָ צִוִּ֣יתָ בֹּ֑קֶר (ידעתה שחר) [יִדַּ֖עְתָּ הַשַּׁ֣חַר] מְקֹמֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Have you ever commanded the day to break,
Assigned the dawn its place,

translations.hebrew: לֶ֭אֱחֹז בְּכַנְפ֣וֹת הָאָ֑רֶץ וְיִנָּעֲר֖וּ רְשָׁ<sup>עִ֣</sup>ים מִמֶּֽנָּה׃
translations.english:
So that it seizes the corners of the earth
And shakes the wicked out of it?

translations.hebrew: תִּ֭תְהַפֵּךְ כְּחֹ֣מֶר חוֹתָ֑ם וְ֝יִֽתְיַצְּב֗וּ כְּמ֣וֹ לְבֽוּשׁ׃
translations.english:
It changes like clay under the seal
Till [its hues] are fixed like those of a garment.

translations.hebrew: וְיִמָּנַ֣ע מֵרְשָׁ<sup>עִ֣</sup>ים אוֹרָ֑ם וּזְר֥וֹעַ רָ֝מָ֗ה תִּשָּׁבֵֽר׃
translations.english:
Their light is withheld from the wicked,
And the upraised arm is broken.

translations.hebrew: הֲ֭בָאתָ עַד־נִבְכֵי־יָ֑ם וּבְחֵ֥קֶר תְּ֝ה֗וֹם הִתְהַלָּֽכְתָּ׃
translations.english:
Have you penetrated to the sources of the sea,
Or walked in the recesses of the deep?

translations.hebrew: הֲנִגְל֣וּ לְ֭ךָ שַׁעֲרֵי־מָ֑וֶת וְשַׁעֲרֵ֖י צַלְמָ֣וֶת תִּרְאֶֽה׃
translations.english:
Have the gates of death been disclosed to you?
Have you seen the gates of deep darkness?

translations.hebrew: הִ֭תְבֹּנַנְתָּ עַד־רַחֲבֵי־אָ֑רֶץ הַ֝גֵּ֗ד אִם־יָדַ֥עְתָּ כֻלָּֽהּ׃
translations.english:
Have you surveyed the expanses of the earth?
If you know of these—tell Me.

translations.hebrew: אֵי־זֶ֣ה הַ֭דֶּרֶךְ יִשְׁכׇּן־א֑וֹר וְ֝חֹ֗שֶׁךְ אֵי־זֶ֥ה מְקֹמֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Which path leads to where light dwells,
And where is the place of darkness,

translations.hebrew: כִּ֣י תִ֭קָּחֶנּוּ אֶל־גְּבוּל֑וֹ וְכִי־תָ֝בִ֗ין נְתִיב֥וֹת בֵּיתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
That you may take it to its domain
And know the way to its home?

translations.hebrew: יָ֭דַעְתָּ כִּי־אָ֣ז תִּוָּלֵ֑ד וּמִסְפַּ֖ר יָמֶ֣יךָ רַבִּֽים׃
translations.english:
Surely you know, for you were born then,
And the number of your years is many!

translations.hebrew: הֲ֭בָאתָ אֶל־אֹצְר֣וֹת שָׁ֑לֶג וְאוֹצְר֖וֹת בָּרָ֣ד תִּרְאֶֽה׃
translations.english:
Have you penetrated the vaults of snow,
Seen the vaults of hail,

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־חָשַׂ֥כְתִּי לְעֶת־צָ֑ר לְי֥וֹם קְ֝רָ֗ב וּמִלְחָמָֽה׃
translations.english:
Which I have put aside for a time of adversity,
For a day of war and battle?

translations.hebrew: אֵי־זֶ֣ה הַ֭דֶּרֶךְ יֵחָ֣לֶק א֑וֹר יָפֵ֖ץ קָדִ֣ים עֲלֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
By what path is the west windaAs Aramaic ’urya. dispersed,
The east wind scattered over the earth?

translations.hebrew: מִֽי־פִלַּ֣ג לַשֶּׁ֣טֶף תְּעָלָ֑ה וְ֝דֶ֗רֶךְ לַחֲזִ֥יז קֹלֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
Who cut a channel for the torrents
And a path for the thunderstorms,

translations.hebrew: לְ֭הַמְטִיר עַל־אֶ֣רֶץ לֹא־אִ֑ישׁ מִ֝דְבָּ֗ר לֹא־אָדָ֥ם בּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
To rain down on uninhabited land,
On the wilderness where no man is,

translations.hebrew: לְהַשְׂבִּ֣יעַ שֹׁ֭אָה וּמְשֹׁאָ֑ה וּ֝לְהַצְמִ֗יחַ מֹ֣צָא דֶֽשֶׁא׃
translations.english:
To saturate the desolate wasteland,
And make the crop of grass sprout forth?

translations.hebrew: הֲיֵשׁ־לַמָּטָ֥ר אָ֑ב א֥וֹ מִי־ה֝וֹלִ֗יד אֶגְלֵי־טָֽל׃
translations.english:
Does the rain have a father?
Who begot the dewdrops?

translations.hebrew: מִבֶּ֣טֶן מִ֭י יָצָ֣א הַקָּ֑רַח וּכְפֹ֥ר שָׁ֝מַ֗יִם מִ֣י יְלָדֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
From whose belly came forth the ice?
Who gave birth to the frost of heaven?

translations.hebrew: כָּ֭אֶבֶן מַ֣יִם יִתְחַבָּ֑אוּ וּפְנֵ֥י תְ֝ה֗וֹם יִתְלַכָּֽדוּ׃
translations.english:
Water congeals like stone,
And the surface of the deep compacts.

translations.hebrew: הַֽ֭תְקַשֵּׁר מַעֲדַנּ֣וֹת כִּימָ֑ה אֽוֹ־מֹשְׁכ֖וֹת כְּסִ֣יל תְּפַתֵּֽחַ׃
translations.english:
Can you tie cords to Pleiades
Or undo the reins of Orion?

translations.hebrew: הֲתֹצִ֣יא מַזָּר֣וֹת בְּעִתּ֑וֹ וְ֝עַ֗יִשׁ עַל־בָּנֶ֥יהָ תַנְחֵֽם׃
translations.english:
Can you lead out MazzarothbEvidently a constellation. in its season,
Conduct the Bear with her sons?

translations.hebrew: הֲ֭יָדַעְתָּ חֻקּ֣וֹת שָׁמָ֑יִם אִם־תָּשִׂ֖ים מִשְׁטָר֣וֹ בָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
Do you know the laws of heaven
Or impose its authority on earth?

translations.hebrew: הֲתָרִ֣ים לָעָ֣ב קוֹלֶ֑ךָ וְֽשִׁפְעַת־מַ֥יִם תְּכַסֶּֽךָּ׃
translations.english:
Can you send up an order to the clouds
For an abundance of water to cover you?

translations.hebrew: הַֽתְשַׁלַּ֣ח בְּרָקִ֣ים וְיֵלֵ֑כוּ וְיֹאמְר֖וּ לְךָ֣ הִנֵּֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
Can you dispatch the lightning on a mission
And have it answer you, “I am ready”?

translations.hebrew: מִי־שָׁ֭ת בַּטֻּח֣וֹת חׇכְמָ֑ה א֤וֹ מִֽי־נָתַ֖ן לַשֶּׂ֣כְוִי בִינָֽה׃
translations.english:
Who put wisdom in the hidden parts?
Who gave understanding to the mind?cOr “rooster”; meaning of Heb. uncertain.

translations.hebrew: מִֽי־יְסַפֵּ֣ר שְׁחָקִ֣ים בְּחׇכְמָ֑ה וְנִבְלֵ֥י שָׁ֝מַ֗יִם מִ֣י יַשְׁכִּֽיב׃
translations.english:
Who is wise enough to give an account of the heavens?
Who can tilt the bottles of the sky,

translations.hebrew: בְּצֶ֣קֶת עָ֭פָר לַמּוּצָ֑ק וּרְגָבִ֥ים יְדֻבָּֽקוּ׃
translations.english:
Whereupon the earth melts into a mass,
And its clods stick together.

translations.hebrew: הֲתָצ֣וּד לְלָבִ֣יא טָ֑רֶף וְחַיַּ֖ת כְּפִירִ֣ים תְּמַלֵּֽא׃
translations.english:
Can you hunt prey for the lion,
And satisfy the appetite of the king of beasts?

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־יָשֹׁ֥חוּ בַמְּעוֹנ֑וֹת יֵשְׁב֖וּ בַסֻּכָּ֣ה לְמוֹ־אָֽרֶב׃
translations.english:
They crouch in their dens,
Lie in ambush in their lairs.

translations.hebrew: מִ֤י יָכִ֥ין לָעֹרֵ֗ב צֵ֫יד֥וֹ כִּֽי־יְ֭לָדָו אֶל־אֵ֣ל יְשַׁוֵּ֑עוּ יִ֝תְע֗וּ לִבְלִי־אֹֽכֶל׃
translations.english:
Who provides food for the raven
When his young cry out to God
And wander about without food?

translations.hebrew: הֲיָדַ֗עְתָּ עֵ֭ת לֶ֣דֶת יַעֲלֵי־סָ֑לַע חֹלֵ֖ל אַיָּל֣וֹת תִּשְׁמֹֽר׃
translations.english:
Do you know the season when the mountain goats give birth?
Can you mark the time when the hinds calve?

translations.hebrew: תִּסְפֹּ֣ר יְרָחִ֣ים תְּמַלֶּ֑אנָה וְ֝יָדַעְתָּ֗ עֵ֣ת לִדְתָּֽנָה׃
translations.english:
Can you count the months they must complete?
Do you know the season they give birth,

translations.hebrew: תִּ֭כְרַעְנָה יַלְדֵיהֶ֣ן תְּפַלַּ֑חְנָה חֶבְלֵיהֶ֥ם תְּשַׁלַּֽחְנָה׃
translations.english:
When they couch to bring forth their offspring,
To deliver their young?

translations.hebrew: יַחְלְמ֣וּ בְ֭נֵיהֶם יִרְבּ֣וּ בַבָּ֑ר יָ֝צְא֗וּ וְלֹא־שָׁ֥בוּ לָֽמוֹ׃
translations.english:
Their young are healthy; they grow up in the open;
They leave and return no more.

translations.hebrew: מִי־שִׁלַּ֣ח פֶּ֣רֶא חׇפְשִׁ֑י וּמֹסְר֥וֹת עָ֝ר֗וֹד מִ֣י פִתֵּֽחַ׃
translations.english:
Who sets the wild ass free?
Who loosens the bonds of the onager,

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־שַׂ֣מְתִּי עֲרָבָ֣ה בֵית֑וֹ וּֽמִשְׁכְּנוֹתָ֥יו מְלֵחָֽה׃
translations.english:
Whose home I have made the wilderness,
The salt land his dwelling-place?

translations.hebrew: יִ֭שְׂחַק לַהֲמ֣וֹן קִרְיָ֑ה תְּשֻׁא֥וֹת נֹ֝גֵ֗שׂ לֹ֣א יִשְׁמָֽע׃
translations.english:
He scoffs at the tumult of the city,
Does not hear the shouts of the driver.

translations.hebrew: יְת֣וּר הָרִ֣ים מִרְעֵ֑הוּ וְאַחַ֖ר כׇּל־יָר֣וֹק יִדְרֽוֹשׁ׃
translations.english:
He roams the hills for his pasture;
He searches for any green thing.

translations.hebrew: הֲיֹ֣אבֶה רֵּ֣ים עׇבְדֶ֑ךָ אִם־יָ֝לִ֗ין עַל־אֲבוּסֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Would the wild ox agree to serve you?
Would he spend the night at your crib?

translations.hebrew: הֲֽתִקְשׇׁר־רֵ֭ים בְּתֶ֣לֶם עֲבֹת֑וֹ אִם־יְשַׂדֵּ֖ד עֲמָקִ֣ים אַחֲרֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Can you hold the wild ox by ropes to the furrow?
Would he plow up the valleys behind you?

translations.hebrew: הֲֽתִבְטַח־בּ֭וֹ כִּֽי־רַ֣ב כֹּח֑וֹ וְתַעֲזֹ֖ב אֵלָ֣יו יְגִיעֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Would you rely on his great strength
And leave your toil to him?

translations.hebrew: הֲתַאֲמִ֣ין בּ֭וֹ כִּֽי־[יָשִׁ֣יב] (ישוב) זַרְעֶ֑ךָ וְֽגׇרְנְךָ֥ יֶאֱסֹֽף׃
translations.english:
Would you trust him to bring in the seed
And gather it in from your threshing floor?

translations.hebrew: כְּנַף־רְנָנִ֥ים נֶעֱלָ֑סָה אִם־אֶ֝בְרָ֗ה חֲסִידָ֥ה וְנֹצָֽה׃
translations.english:
The wing of the ostrich beats joyously;
Are her pinions and plumage like the stork’s?

translations.hebrew: כִּי־תַעֲזֹ֣ב לָאָ֣רֶץ בֵּצֶ֑יהָ וְֽעַל־עָפָ֥ר תְּחַמֵּֽם׃
translations.english:
She leaves her eggs on the ground,
Letting them warm in the dirt,

translations.hebrew: וַ֭תִּשְׁכַּח כִּי־רֶ֣גֶל תְּזוּרֶ֑הָ וְחַיַּ֖ת הַשָּׂדֶ֣ה תְדוּשֶֽׁהָ׃
translations.english:
Forgetting they may be crushed underfoot,
Or trampled by a wild beast.

translations.hebrew: הִקְשִׁ֣יחַ בָּנֶ֣יהָ לְּלֹא־לָ֑הּ לְרִ֖יק יְגִיעָ֣הּ בְּלִי־פָֽחַד׃
translations.english:
Her young are cruelly abandoned as if they were not hers;
Her labor is in vain for lack of concern.

translations.hebrew: כִּי־הִשָּׁ֣הּ אֱל֣וֹהַּ חׇכְמָ֑ה וְלֹא־חָ֥לַק לָ֝֗הּ בַּבִּינָֽה׃
translations.english:
For God deprived her of wisdom,
Gave her no share of understanding,

translations.hebrew: כָּ֭עֵת בַּמָּר֣וֹם תַּמְרִ֑יא תִּֽשְׂחַ֥ק לַ֝סּ֗וּס וּלְרֹכְבֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Else she would soar on high,
Scoffing at the horse and its rider.

translations.hebrew: הֲתִתֵּ֣ן לַסּ֣וּס גְּבוּרָ֑ה הֲתַלְבִּ֖ישׁ צַוָּאר֣וֹ רַעְמָֽה׃
translations.english:
Do you give the horse his strength?
Do you clothe his neck with a mane?

translations.hebrew: הֲֽ֭תַרְעִישֶׁנּוּ כָּאַרְבֶּ֑ה ה֖וֹד נַחְר֣וֹ אֵימָֽה׃
translations.english:
Do you make him quiver like locusts,
His majestic snorting [spreading] terror?

translations.hebrew: יַחְפְּר֣וּ בָ֭עֵמֶק וְיָשִׂ֣ישׂ בְּכֹ֑חַ יֵ֝צֵ֗א לִקְרַאת־נָֽשֶׁק׃
translations.english:
HeaLit. “They …” paws with force, he runs with vigor,
Charging into battle.

translations.hebrew: יִשְׂחַ֣ק לְ֭פַחַד וְלֹ֣א יֵחָ֑ת וְלֹא־יָ֝שׁ֗וּב מִפְּנֵי־חָֽרֶב׃
translations.english:
He scoffs at fear; he cannot be frightened;
He does not recoil from the sword.

translations.hebrew: עָ֭לָיו תִּרְנֶ֣ה אַשְׁפָּ֑ה לַ֖הַב חֲנִ֣ית וְכִידֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
A quiverful of arrows whizzes by him,
And the flashing spear and the javelin.

translations.hebrew: בְּרַ֣עַשׁ וְ֭רֹגֶז יְגַמֶּא־אָ֑רֶץ וְלֹא־יַ֝אֲמִ֗ין כִּי־ק֥וֹל שׁוֹפָֽר׃
translations.english:
Trembling with excitement, he swallowsbOr “digs up.” the land;
He does not turn aside at the blast of the trumpet.

translations.hebrew: בְּדֵ֤י שֹׁפָ֨ר ׀ יֹ֘אמַ֤ר הֶאָ֗ח וּֽ֭מֵרָחוֹק יָרִ֣יחַ מִלְחָמָ֑ה רַ֥עַם שָׂ֝רִ֗ים וּתְרוּעָֽה׃
translations.english:
As the trumpet sounds, he says, “Aha!”
From afar he smells the battle,
The roaring and shouting of the officers.

translations.hebrew: הֲֽ֭מִבִּינָ֣תְךָ יַאֲבֶר־נֵ֑ץ יִפְרֹ֖שׂ כְּנָפָ֣ו לְתֵימָֽן׃
translations.english:
Is it by your wisdom that the hawk grows pinions,
Spreads his wings to the south?

translations.hebrew: אִם־עַל־פִּ֭יךָ יַגְבִּ֣יהַּ נָ֑שֶׁר וְ֝כִ֗י יָרִ֥ים קִנּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Does the eagle soar at your command,
Building his nest high,

translations.hebrew: סֶ֣לַע יִ֭שְׁכֹּן וְיִתְלֹנָ֑ן עַ֥ל שֶׁן־סֶ֝֗לַע וּמְצוּדָֽה׃
translations.english:
Dwelling in the rock,
Lodging upon the fastness of a jutting rock?

translations.hebrew: מִשָּׁ֥ם חָֽפַר־אֹ֑כֶל לְ֝מֵרָח֗וֹק עֵינָ֥יו יַבִּֽיטוּ׃
translations.english:
From there he spies out his food;
From afar his eyes see it.

translations.hebrew: וְאֶפְרֹחָ֥ו יְעַלְעוּ־דָ֑ם וּבַאֲשֶׁ֥ר חֲ֝לָלִ֗ים שָׁ֣ם הֽוּא׃
translations.english:
His young gulp blood;
Where the slain are, there is he.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַן יְהֹוָ֥ה אֶת־אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
translations.english: The LORD said in reply to Job.

translations.hebrew: הֲ֭רֹב עִם־שַׁדַּ֣י יִסּ֑וֹר מוֹכִ֖יחַ אֱל֣וֹהַּ יַעֲנֶֽנָּה׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Shall one who should be disciplined complain against Shaddai?-a
He who arraigns God must respond.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַן אִיּ֥וֹב אֶת־יְהֹוָ֗ה וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
translations.english: Job said in reply to the LORD:

translations.hebrew: הֵ֣ן קַ֭לֹּתִי מָ֣ה אֲשִׁיבֶ֑ךָּ יָ֝דִ֗י שַׂ֣מְתִּי לְמוֹ־פִֽי׃
translations.english:
See, I am of small worth; what can I answer You?
I clap my hand to my mouth.

translations.hebrew: אַחַ֣ת דִּ֭בַּרְתִּי וְלֹ֣א אֶעֱנֶ֑ה וּ֝שְׁתַּ֗יִם וְלֹ֣א אוֹסִֽיף׃
translations.english:
I have spoken once, and will not reply;
Twice, and will do so no more.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּעַן־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֶת־אִ֭יּוֹב (מנסערה) [מִ֥ן ׀ סְעָרָ֗ה] וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
translations.english: Then the LORD replied to Job out of the tempest and said:

translations.hebrew: אֱזׇר־נָ֣א כְגֶ֣בֶר חֲלָצֶ֑יךָ אֶ֝שְׁאָלְךָ֗ וְהוֹדִיעֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Gird your loins like a man;
I will ask, and you will inform Me.

translations.hebrew: הַ֭אַף תָּפֵ֣ר מִשְׁפָּטִ֑י תַּ֝רְשִׁיעֵ֗נִי לְמַ֣עַן תִּצְדָּֽק׃
translations.english:
Would you impugn My justice?
Would you condemn Me that you may be right?

translations.hebrew: וְאִם־זְר֖וֹעַ כָּאֵ֥ל <small>׀</small> לָ֑ךְ וּ֝בְק֗וֹל כָּמֹ֥הוּ תַרְעֵֽם׃
translations.english:
Have you an arm like God’s?
Can you thunder with a voice like His?

translations.hebrew: עֲדֵ֥ה נָ֣א גָא֣וֹן וָגֹ֑בַהּ וְה֖וֹד וְהָדָ֣ר תִּלְבָּֽשׁ׃
translations.english:
Deck yourself now with grandeur and eminence;
Clothe yourself in glory and majesty.

translations.hebrew: הָ֭פֵץ עֶבְר֣וֹת אַפֶּ֑ךָ וּרְאֵ֥ה כׇל־גֵּ֝אֶ֗ה וְהַשְׁפִּילֵֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
Scatter wide your raging anger;
See every proud man and bring him low.

translations.hebrew: רְאֵ֣ה כׇל־גֵּ֭אֶה הַכְנִיעֵ֑הוּ וַהֲדֹ֖ךְ רְשָׁעִ֣ים תַּחְתָּֽם׃
translations.english:
See every proud man and humble him,
And bring them down where they stand.

translations.hebrew: טׇמְנֵ֣ם בֶּעָפָ֣ר יָ֑חַד פְּ֝נֵיהֶ֗ם חֲבֹ֣שׁ בַּטָּמֽוּן׃
translations.english:
Bury them all in the earth;
Hide their faces in obscurity.

translations.hebrew: וְגַם־אֲנִ֥י אוֹדֶ֑ךָּ כִּֽי־תוֹשִׁ֖עַ לְךָ֣ יְמִינֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Then even I would praise you
For the triumph your right hand won you.

translations.hebrew: הִנֵּה־נָ֣א בְ֭הֵמוֹת אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂ֣יתִי עִמָּ֑ךְ חָ֝צִ֗יר כַּבָּקָ֥ר יֹאכֵֽל׃
translations.english:
Take now behemoth, whom I made as I did you;
He eats grass, like the cattle.

translations.hebrew: הִנֵּה־נָ֣א כֹח֣וֹ בְמׇתְנָ֑יו וְ֝אוֹנ֗וֹ בִּשְׁרִירֵ֥י בִטְנֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
His strength is in his loins,
His might in the muscles of his belly.

translations.hebrew: יַחְפֹּ֣ץ זְנָב֣וֹ כְמוֹ־אָ֑רֶז גִּידֵ֖י פַחֲדָ֣ו יְשֹׂרָֽגוּ׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.He makes his tail stand up-a like a cedar;
The sinews of his thighs are knit together.

translations.hebrew: עֲ֭צָמָיו אֲפִיקֵ֣י נְחֻשָׁ֑ה גְּ֝רָמָ֗יו כִּמְטִ֥יל בַּרְזֶֽל׃
translations.english:
His bones are like tubes of bronze,
His limbs like iron rods.

translations.hebrew: ה֭וּא רֵאשִׁ֣ית דַּרְכֵי־אֵ֑ל הָ֝עֹשׂ֗וֹ יַגֵּ֥שׁ חַרְבּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He is the first of God’s works;
Only his Maker can draw the sword against him.

translations.hebrew: כִּי־ב֭וּל הָרִ֣ים יִשְׂאוּ־ל֑וֹ וְֽכׇל־חַיַּ֥ת הַ֝שָּׂדֶ֗ה יְשַׂחֲקוּ־שָֽׁם׃
translations.english:
The mountains yield him produce,
Where all the beasts of the field play.

translations.hebrew: תַּֽחַת־צֶאֱלִ֥ים יִשְׁכָּ֑ב בְּסֵ֖תֶר קָנֶ֣ה וּבִצָּֽה׃
translations.english:
He lies down beneath the lotuses,
In the cover of the swamp reeds.

translations.hebrew: יְסֻכֻּ֣הוּ צֶאֱלִ֣ים צִֽלְל֑וֹ יְ֝סֻבּ֗וּהוּ עַרְבֵי־נָֽחַל׃
translations.english:
The lotuses embower him with shade;
The willows of the brook surround him.

translations.hebrew: הֵ֤ן יַעֲשֹׁ֣ק נָ֭הָר לֹ֣א יַחְפּ֑וֹז יִבְטַ֓ח ׀ כִּֽי־יָגִ֖יחַ יַרְדֵּ֣ן אֶל־פִּֽיהוּ׃
translations.english:
He can restrain the river from its rushing;
He is confident the streambLit. “Jordan.” will gush at his command.

translations.hebrew: בְּעֵינָ֥יו יִקָּחֶ֑נּוּ בְּ֝מוֹקְשִׁ֗ים יִנְקׇב־אָֽף׃
translations.english:
Can he be taken by his eyes?
Can his nose be pierced by hooks?

translations.hebrew: תִּמְשֹׁ֣ךְ לִוְיָתָ֣ן בְּחַכָּ֑ה וּ֝בְחֶ֗בֶל תַּשְׁקִ֥יעַ לְשֹׁנֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Can you draw out Leviathan by a fishhook?
Can you press down his tongue by a rope?

translations.hebrew: הֲתָשִׂ֣ים אַגְמֹ֣ן בְּאַפּ֑וֹ וּ֝בְח֗וֹחַ תִּקֹּ֥ב לֶחֱיֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Can you put a ring through his nose,
Or pierce his jaw with a barb?

translations.hebrew: הֲיַרְבֶּ֣ה אֵ֭לֶיךָ תַּחֲנוּנִ֑ים אִם־יְדַבֵּ֖ר אֵלֶ֣יךָ רַכּֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
Will he plead with you at length?
Will he speak soft words to you?

translations.hebrew: הֲיִכְרֹ֣ת בְּרִ֣ית עִמָּ֑ךְ תִּ֝קָּחֶ֗נּוּ לְעֶ֣בֶד עוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
Will he make an agreement with you
To be taken as your lifelong slave?

translations.hebrew: הַֽתְשַׂחֶק־בּ֭וֹ כַּצִּפּ֑וֹר וְ֝תִקְשְׁרֶ֗נּוּ לְנַעֲרוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Will you play with him like a bird,
And tie him down for your girls?

translations.hebrew: יִכְר֣וּ עָ֭לָיו חַבָּרִ֑ים יֶ֝חֱצ֗וּהוּ בֵּ֣ין כְּֽנַעֲנִֽים׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Shall traders traffic in him?-a
Will he be divided up among merchants?

translations.hebrew: הַֽתְמַלֵּ֣א בְשֻׂכּ֣וֹת עוֹר֑וֹ וּבְצִלְצַ֖ל דָּגִ֣ים רֹאשֽׁוֹ׃
translations.english:
Can you fill his skin with darts
Or his head with fish-spears?

translations.hebrew: שִׂים־עָלָ֥יו כַּפֶּ֑ךָ זְכֹ֥ר מִ֝לְחָמָ֗ה אַל־תּוֹסַֽף׃
translations.english:
Lay a hand on him,
And you will never think of battle again.

translations.hebrew: הֵן־תֹּחַלְתּ֥וֹ נִכְזָ֑בָה הֲגַ֖ם אֶל־מַרְאָ֣יו יֻטָֽל׃
translations.english:
See, any hope [of capturing] him must be disappointed;
One is prostrated by the very sight of him.

translations.hebrew: לֹֽא־אַ֭כְזָר כִּ֣י יְעוּרֶ֑נּוּ וּמִ֥י ה֝֗וּא לְפָנַ֥י יִתְיַצָּֽב׃
translations.english:
There is no one so fierce as to rouse him;
Who then can stand up to Me?

translations.hebrew: מִ֣י הִ֭קְדִּימַנִי וַאֲשַׁלֵּ֑ם תַּ֖חַת כׇּל־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם לִי־הֽוּא׃
translations.english:
Whoever confronts Me I will requite,
For everything under the heavens is Mine.

translations.hebrew: (לא) [לוֹ־]אַחֲרִ֥ישׁ בַּדָּ֑יו וּדְבַר־גְּ֝בוּר֗וֹת וְחִ֣ין עֶרְכּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.I will not be silent concerning him
Or the praise of his martial exploits.-a

translations.hebrew: מִֽי־גִ֭לָּה פְּנֵ֣י לְבוּשׁ֑וֹ בְּכֶ֥פֶל רִ֝סְנ֗וֹ מִ֣י יָבֽוֹא׃
translations.english:
Who can uncover his outer garment?
Who can penetrate the folds of his jowls?

translations.hebrew: דַּלְתֵ֣י פָ֭נָיו מִ֣י פִתֵּ֑חַ סְבִיב֖וֹת שִׁנָּ֣יו אֵימָֽה׃
translations.english:
Who can pry open the doors of his face?
His bared teeth strike terror.

translations.hebrew: גַּ֭אֲוָה אֲפִיקֵ֣י מָגִנִּ֑ים סָ֝ג֗וּר חוֹתָ֥ם צָֽר׃
translations.english:
His protective scales are his pride,
Locked with a binding seal.

translations.hebrew: אֶחָ֣ד בְּאֶחָ֣ד יִגַּ֑שׁוּ וְ֝ר֗וּחַ לֹא־יָבֹ֥א בֵינֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
One scale touches the other;
Not even a breath can enter between them.

translations.hebrew: אִישׁ־בְּאָחִ֥יהוּ יְדֻבָּ֑קוּ יִ֝תְלַכְּד֗וּ וְלֹ֣א יִתְפָּרָֽדוּ׃
translations.english:
Each clings to each;
They are interlocked so they cannot be parted.

translations.hebrew: עֲֽ֭טִישֹׁתָיו תָּ֣הֶל א֑וֹר וְ֝עֵינָ֗יו כְּעַפְעַפֵּי־שָֽׁחַר׃
translations.english:
His sneezings flash lightning,
And his eyes are like the glimmerings of dawn.

translations.hebrew: מִ֭פִּיו לַפִּידִ֣ים יַהֲלֹ֑כוּ כִּיד֥וֹדֵי אֵ֝֗שׁ יִתְמַלָּֽטוּ׃
translations.english:
Firebrands stream from his mouth;
Fiery sparks escape.

translations.hebrew: מִ֭נְּחִירָיו יֵצֵ֣א עָשָׁ֑ן כְּד֖וּד נָפ֣וּחַ וְאַגְמֹֽן׃
translations.english:
Out of his nostrils comes smoke
As from a steaming, boiling cauldron.

translations.hebrew: נַ֭פְשׁוֹ גֶּחָלִ֣ים תְּלַהֵ֑ט וְ֝לַ֗הַב מִפִּ֥יו יֵצֵֽא׃
translations.english:
His breath ignites coals;
Flames blaze from his mouth.

translations.hebrew: בְּֽ֭צַוָּארוֹ יָלִ֣ין עֹ֑ז וּ֝לְפָנָ֗יו תָּד֥וּץ דְּאָבָֽה׃
translations.english:
Strength resides in his neck;
Power leaps before him.

translations.hebrew: מַפְּלֵ֣י בְשָׂר֣וֹ דָבֵ֑קוּ יָצ֥וּק עָ֝לָ֗יו בַּל־יִמּֽוֹט׃
translations.english:
The layers of his flesh stick together;
He is as though cast hard; he does not totter.

translations.hebrew: לִ֭בּוֹ יָצ֣וּק כְּמוֹ־אָ֑בֶן וְ֝יָצ֗וּק כְּפֶ֣לַח תַּחְתִּֽית׃
translations.english:
His heart is cast hard as a stone,
Hard as the nether millstone.

translations.hebrew: מִ֭שֵּׂתוֹ יָג֣וּרוּ אֵלִ֑ים מִ֝שְּׁבָרִ֗ים יִתְחַטָּֽאוּ׃
translations.english:
Divine beings are in dread as he rears up;
As he crashes down, they cringe.

translations.hebrew: מַשִּׂיגֵ֣הוּ חֶ֭רֶב בְּלִ֣י תָק֑וּם חֲנִ֖ית מַסָּ֣ע וְשִׁרְיָֽה׃
translations.english:
No sword that overtakes him can prevail,
Nor spear, nor missile, nor lance.

translations.hebrew: יַחְשֹׁ֣ב לְתֶ֣בֶן בַּרְזֶ֑ל לְעֵ֖ץ רִקָּב֣וֹן נְחוּשָֽׁה׃
translations.english:
He regards iron as straw,
Bronze, as rotted wood.

translations.hebrew: לֹא־יַבְרִיחֶ֥נּוּ בֶן־קָ֑שֶׁת לְ֝קַ֗שׁ נֶהְפְּכוּ־ל֥וֹ אַבְנֵי־קָֽלַע׃
translations.english:
No arrow can put him to flight;
Slingstones turn into stubble for him.

translations.hebrew: כְּ֭קַשׁ נֶחְשְׁב֣וּ תוֹתָ֑ח וְ֝יִשְׂחַ֗ק לְרַ֣עַשׁ כִּידֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
ClubsaMeaning of Heb. uncertain. are regarded as stubble;
He scoffs at the quivering javelin.

translations.hebrew: תַּ֭חְתָּיו חַדּ֣וּדֵי חָ֑רֶשׂ יִרְפַּ֖ד חָר֣וּץ עֲלֵי־טִֽיט׃
translations.english:
His underpart is jagged shards;
It spreads a threshing-sledge on the mud.

translations.hebrew: יַרְתִּ֣יחַ כַּסִּ֣יר מְצוּלָ֑ה יָ֝֗ם יָשִׂ֥ים כַּמֶּרְקָחָֽה׃
translations.english:
He makes the depths seethe like a cauldron;
He makes the sea [boil] like an ointment-pot.

translations.hebrew: אַ֭חֲרָיו יָאִ֣יר נָתִ֑יב יַחְשֹׁ֖ב תְּה֣וֹם לְשֵׂיבָֽה׃
translations.english:
His wake is a luminous path;
He makes the deep seem white-haired.

translations.hebrew: אֵֽין־עַל־עָפָ֥ר מׇשְׁל֑וֹ הֶ֝עָשׂ֗וּ לִבְלִי־חָֽת׃
translations.english:
There is no one on land who can dominate him,
Made as he is without fear.

translations.hebrew: אֵֽת־כׇּל־גָּבֹ֥הַּ יִרְאֶ֑ה ה֝֗וּא מֶ֣לֶךְ עַל־כׇּל־בְּנֵי־שָֽׁחַץ׃
translations.english:
He sees all that is haughty;
He is king over all proud beasts.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַן אִיּ֥וֹב אֶת־יְהֹוָ֗ה וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
translations.english: Job said in reply to the LORD:

translations.hebrew: (ידעת) [יָ֭דַעְתִּי] כִּי־כֹ֣ל תּוּכָ֑ל וְלֹֽא־יִבָּצֵ֖ר מִמְּךָ֣ מְזִמָּֽה׃
translations.english:
I know that You can do everything,
That nothing You propose is impossible for You.

translations.hebrew: מִ֤י זֶ֨ה ׀ מַעְלִ֥ים עֵצָ֗ה בְּֽלִ֫י־דָ֥עַת לָכֵ֣ן הִ֭גַּדְתִּי וְלֹ֣א אָבִ֑ין נִפְלָא֥וֹת מִ֝מֶּ֗נִּי וְלֹ֣א אֵדָֽע׃
translations.english:
Who is this who obscures counsel without knowledge?
Indeed, I spoke without understanding
Of things beyond me, which I did not know.

translations.hebrew: שְֽׁמַֽע־נָ֭א וְאָנֹכִ֣י אֲדַבֵּ֑ר אֶ֝שְׁאָלְךָ֗ וְהוֹדִיעֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Hear now, and I will speak;
I will ask, and You will inform me.

translations.hebrew: לְשֵֽׁמַע־אֹ֥זֶן שְׁמַעְתִּ֑יךָ וְ֝עַתָּ֗ה עֵינִ֥י רָאָֽתְךָ׃
translations.english:
I had heard You with my ears,
But now I see You with my eyes;

translations.hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֭ן אֶמְאַ֣ס וְנִחַ֑מְתִּי עַל־עָפָ֥ר וָאֵֽפֶר׃
translations.english:
Therefore, I recant and relent,
Being but dust and ashes.

translations.hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י אַחַ֨ר דִּבֶּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה אֶל־אִיּ֑וֹב וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־אֱלִיפַ֣ז הַתֵּימָנִ֗י חָרָ֨ה אַפִּ֤י בְךָ֙ וּבִשְׁנֵ֣י רֵעֶ֔יךָ כִּ֠י לֹ֣א דִבַּרְתֶּ֥ם אֵלַ֛י נְכוֹנָ֖ה כְּעַבְדִּ֥י אִיּֽוֹב׃
translations.english: After the L<small>ORD</small> had spoken these words to Job, the L<small>ORD</small> said to Eliphaz the Temanite, “I am incensed at you and your two friends, for you have not spoken the truth about Me as did My servant Job.

translations.hebrew: וְעַתָּ֡ה קְחוּ־לָכֶ֣ם שִׁבְעָֽה־פָרִים֩ וְשִׁבְעָ֨ה אֵילִ֜ים וּלְכ֣וּ ׀ אֶל־עַבְדִּ֣י אִיּ֗וֹב וְהַעֲלִיתֶ֤ם עוֹלָה֙ בַּעַדְכֶ֔ם וְאִיּ֣וֹב עַבְדִּ֔י יִתְפַּלֵּ֖ל עֲלֵיכֶ֑ם כִּ֧י אִם־פָּנָ֣יו אֶשָּׂ֗א לְבִלְתִּ֞י עֲשׂ֤וֹת עִמָּכֶם֙ נְבָלָ֔ה כִּ֠י לֹ֣א דִבַּרְתֶּ֥ם אֵלַ֛י נְכוֹנָ֖ה כְּעַבְדִּ֥י אִיּֽוֹב׃
translations.english: Now take seven bulls and seven rams and go to My servant Job and sacrifice a burnt offering for yourselves. And let Job, My servant, pray for you; for to him I will show favor and not treat you vilely, since you have not spoken the truth about Me as did My servant Job.”

translations.hebrew: וַיֵּלְכוּ֩ אֱלִיפַ֨ז הַתֵּימָנִ֜י וּבִלְדַּ֣ד הַשּׁוּחִ֗י צֹפַר֙ הַנַּ֣עֲמָתִ֔י וַיַּעֲשׂ֔וּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּשָּׂ֥א יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־פְּנֵ֥י אִיּֽוֹב׃
translations.english: Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went and did as the L<small>ORD</small> had told them, and the L<small>ORD</small> showed favor to Job.

translations.hebrew: וַיהֹוָ֗ה שָׁ֚ב אֶת־[שְׁב֣וּת] (שבית) אִיּ֔וֹב בְּהִֽתְפַּֽלְל֖וֹ בְּעַ֣ד רֵעֵ֑הוּ וַיֹּ֧סֶף יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְאִיּ֖וֹב לְמִשְׁנֶֽה׃
translations.english: The L<small>ORD</small> restored Job’s fortunes when he prayed on behalf of his friends, and the L<small>ORD</small> gave Job twice what he had before.

translations.hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ אֵ֠לָ֠יו כׇּל־אֶחָ֨יו וְכׇל־אַחְיֹתָ֜יו וְכׇל־יֹדְעָ֣יו לְפָנִ֗ים וַיֹּאכְל֨וּ עִמּ֣וֹ לֶ֘חֶם֮ בְּבֵיתוֹ֒ וַיָּנֻ֤דוּ לוֹ֙ וַיְנַחֲמ֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ עַ֚ל כׇּל־הָ֣רָעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־הֵבִ֥יא יְהֹוָ֖ה עָלָ֑יו וַיִּתְּנוּ־ל֗וֹ אִ֚ישׁ קְשִׂיטָ֣ה אֶחָ֔ת וְאִ֕ישׁ נֶ֥זֶם זָהָ֖ב אֶחָֽד׃
translations.english: All his brothers and sisters and all his former friends came to him and had a meal with him in his house. They consoled and comforted him for all the misfortune that the LORD had brought upon him. Each gave him one kesitahaA unit of unknown value. and each one gold ring.

translations.hebrew: וַיהֹוָ֗ה בֵּרַ֛ךְ אֶת־אַחֲרִ֥ית אִיּ֖וֹב מֵרֵֽאשִׁת֑וֹ וַֽיְהִי־ל֡וֹ אַרְבָּעָה֩ עָשָׂ֨ר אֶ֜לֶף צֹ֗אן וְשֵׁ֤שֶׁת אֲלָפִים֙ גְּמַלִּ֔ים וְאֶלֶף־צֶ֥מֶד בָּקָ֖ר וְאֶ֥לֶף אֲתוֹנֽוֹת׃
translations.english: Thus the L<small>ORD</small> blessed the latter years of Job’s life more than the former. He had fourteen thousand sheep, six thousand camels, one thousand yoke of oxen, and one thousand she-asses.

translations.hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־ל֛וֹ שִׁבְעָ֥נָה בָנִ֖ים וְשָׁל֥וֹשׁ בָּנֽוֹת׃
translations.english: He also had seven sons and three daughters.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֤א שֵׁם־הָאַחַת֙ יְמִימָ֔ה וְשֵׁ֥ם הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית קְצִיעָ֑ה וְשֵׁ֥ם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֖ית קֶ֥רֶן הַפּֽוּךְ׃
translations.english: The first he named Jemimah, the second Keziah, and the third Keren-happuch.

translations.hebrew: וְלֹ֨א נִמְצָ֜א נָשִׁ֥ים יָפ֛וֹת כִּבְנ֥וֹת אִיּ֖וֹב בְּכׇל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּתֵּ֨ן לָהֶ֧ם אֲבִיהֶ֛ם נַחֲלָ֖ה בְּת֥וֹךְ אֲחֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english: Nowhere in the land were women as beautiful as Job’s daughters to be found. Their father gave them estates together with their brothers.

translations.hebrew: וַיְחִ֤י אִיּוֹב֙ אַחֲרֵי־זֹ֔את מֵאָ֥ה וְאַרְבָּעִ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה (וירא) [וַיִּרְאֶ֗ה] אֶת־בָּנָיו֙ וְאֶת־בְּנֵ֣י בָנָ֔יו אַרְבָּעָ֖ה דֹּרֽוֹת׃
translations.english: Afterward, Job lived one hundred and forty years to see four generations of sons and grandsons.

translations.hebrew: וַיָּ֣מׇת אִיּ֔וֹב זָקֵ֖ן וּשְׂבַ֥ע יָמִֽים׃
translations.english: So Job died old and contented.
